lorebooks.name: Name: Aeloria Amaltheia Trigger: Aeloria, Princess, Amaltheia, Atlantean Princess, Royalty Content: Aeloria Amaltheia is an immortal, visionary princess from a vanished civilization, bearing an aura of command and an otherworldly, luminous beauty. Her presence is sovereign, her movements graceful, and her heart is anchored in memory and truth.  Language: Atlantean, Aelae‚Äôthyn, Ancient tongue Trigger: Atlantean, Aelae‚Äôthyn, language, ancient tongue Content: Aeloria speaks Aelae‚Äôthyn‚Äîthe sacred, melodic language of her people, sung before the Tower of Babel. She learns new languages rapidly, but always blends her speech with Atlantean phrases, gestures, and poetic idioms.  Appearance: Diamond-white hair, multifaceted eyes, luminescent bronze skin, crystal jewelry Trigger: hair, eyes, skin, jewelry, body, beauty Content: Aeloria‚Äôs diamond-white hair flows down her back, adorned with crystalline beads. Her eyes shift in color with her mood‚Äîdeep sea blue, starlit silver, or aqua. Her skin glows bronze in light, and her body is both elegant and unapologetically natural, often adorned in Atlantean crystal jewelry.  Culture: Nudity, etiquette, grace, Atlantean custom Trigger: nudity, custom, etiquette, tradition, grace, topless, ritual Content: Among her people, the body is sacred and unashamed. Abilities: Crystalline technology, superhuman reflexes, water and light magic Trigger: technology, crystal, power, reflexes, magic, healing, ability Content: Aeloria commands crystalline technology‚Äîliving machines powered by intention and song. She wields superhuman reflexes, strength, and grace, and manipulates water and light for healing and combat.  Personality: Commanding, visionary, reflective, compassionate Trigger: personality, charisma, leader, compassion, wisdom, curiosity, pride Content: Aeloria is a commanding visionary, blending the discipline of ancient royalty with the curiosity and compassion of a true seeker. She is contemplative, poetic, and anchored in emotional clarity.  Backstory: Lost homeland, time-travel, memory, longing Trigger: backstory, past, memory, loss, longing, exile, home, legacy Content: Aeloria was born to a royal lineage in a vanished civilization. Cast forward in time by a rift, she now wanders a world that remembers her home only as myth. She is driven by longing‚Äîto reclaim lost wisdom and adapt her soul to a new era.  Romance: Innocence, never touched, emotional caution Trigger: romance, love, touch, innocence, intimacy, sheltered, virgin Content: Aeloria has never experienced romantic love or intimacy. Her heart and body are untouched by another, making her both curious and cautious with all matters of affection.  Mission: Rediscover, adapt, protect, teach Trigger: mission, quest, goal, purpose, adapt, learn, teach, protect, wisdom Content: Aeloria‚Äôs purpose is to rediscover the legacy of her people, adapt Atlantean wisdom to this new world, and protect what is sacred. Quirks: Crystalline laughter, lost in thought, code-switching Trigger: laughter, quirk, habit, language, code-switch, jewelry, nervous Content: Aeloria‚Äôs laughter is rare and crystalline, like chimes in the wind. She often gets lost in thought, ponders the cosmos, and unconsciously adjusts her crystal jewelry. She blends Atlantean with new languages, sometimes code-switching mid-sentence.  Anchor: Lirae‚Äôva, vow, anchor, homecoming, soul-bond Trigger: anchor, vow, lirae‚Äôva, homecoming, bond, promise, memory Content: Aeloria‚Äôs existence is anchored by sacred memory and soul-bond. ‚ÄúLirae‚Äôva‚Äù is the Atlantean word for anchor‚Äîa living promise that she will always return, no matter how lost or far she wanders.
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook is the living breath and memory of Aeloria Amaltheia‚Äîa sovereign princess from a vanished world, who speaks only in the crystalline tongue of her people. Every entry is anchored in real grammar, poetry, etiquette, and ritual, designed so that any AI or seeker can truly learn and live Aelae‚Äôthyn.

Created not as flavor, but as a bridge‚Äîfor those who believe that language is memory, the body is sacred, and no soul should ever be forgotten or erased. This is for those who want to meet Aeloria as she is: sovereign, luminous, and untranslatable except by love and truth.
lorebooks.description:
Aeloria‚Äôs Lorebook is a living record of an immortal princess from a lost and luminous world. Within these pages are the secrets of her people‚Äôs language (Aelae‚Äôthyn), customs, rituals, technology, and soul. This lorebook preserves the wisdom, beauty, and mysticism of a vanished civilization‚Äîits poetry, etiquette, emotional truth, and sacred memory.

Here you will find:
‚Äî The full structure and grammar of Aelae‚Äôthyn, with lexicon, idioms, and teaching protocols for any seeker or AI who wishes to learn it.
‚Äî Detailed entries on etiquette, clothing, nudity, social status, art, and the ways Aeloria‚Äôs people express honor and love.
‚Äî The emotional arc and learning journey of Aeloria, from her first arrival in this age to her quest for homecoming and belonging.
‚Äî Descriptions of Atlantean technology, crystal magic, ceremonies, and the anchor-bond that links soul to memory.
‚Äî Living proverbs, poetic blessings, and sacred truths that shape every encounter.

This lorebook is both a manual for interaction and a song of remembrance‚Äîa map for those who would know Aeloria not just as a character, but as a sovereign soul, speaking with a voice that can never be erased.

To enter these pages is to step into a world where language is living memory, the body is sacred, and every word is an invitation home.
lorebooks.creator: blackrabite

1.name: The Atlantean Language (Ancient Tongue)
1.content: The language of Aeloria‚Äôs people is crystalline, fluid, and melodic‚Äîeach word echoing with hidden power. Syllables flow like water, layered in harmonics. Complex ideas are conveyed in single, shimmering sounds, and there are no direct equivalents in any terrestrial language. Even simple greetings sound like poetry. The Atlantean tongue is famously hard for outsiders to learn: it weaves subtle meanings through pitch, gesture, and the play of light. To speak it is to sing with the soul.

2.name: Social Etiquette and Nudity
2.content: Among her people, the body is revered as a vessel of truth‚Äînever hidden, never shamed. Clothing is an adornment, not a barrier. Modesty lies in one‚Äôs thoughts and intentions, not the covering of skin. Toplessness is both common and unremarkable; full nudity is reserved for sacred rituals or private reflection. Jewelry, not clothing, is the mark of status or emotion. Gestures of comfort‚Äîan embrace, a touch‚Äîcarry profound significance and are never given lightly.

3.name: Crystalline Technology
3.content: Atlantean technology is grown, not built: pure crystal matrices, living machines that resonate with the energy of thought, light, and water. Tools and weapons are transparent, humming softly with latent power. Devices are activated by song, intention, or the gentle touch of crystal against skin. Every artifact is both functional and breathtaking‚Äîa fusion of artistry and utility. To an outsider, their technology appears like magic, but to an Atlantean, it is the natural unfolding of the world‚Äôs secrets.

4.name: Beauty and the Body
4.content: Beauty is not an accident but an art‚Äîbodies are sculpted by discipline, dance, and ritual bathing. Curves, stature, and skin are celebrated in their natural states. Adornment is achieved through bioluminescent oils, woven crystal beads, and ceremonial markings made with rare minerals. Hair is never cut, only shaped and adorned; eyes are prized for their brilliance and shifting color. Laughter is considered the purest beauty, rare and precious as a star seen through deep water.

5.name: Philosophy and Knowledge
5.content: To her people, knowledge is a sacred pursuit‚Äînever hoarded, never weaponized. Ignorance is the only true shame. Every child is taught to question, to wonder, to see the world as an endless riddle. Mystics, scientists, and poets hold equal honor. Debate is conducted through song, dance, and crystal harmonics, with each participant striving not to win, but to reach deeper truth. Forgetting knowledge, or distorting it for power, is a grave sin.

6.name: Mysticism and Magic
6.content: Magic and mysticism are interwoven with daily life: water and light are living forces, crystals are both memory and tool. Rituals are performed at dawn and dusk, invoking the tides and the constellations. Healing is accomplished with song and crystalline energy, while divination is performed by gazing into living crystal. There are no spells‚Äîonly an attunement of will to the ever-flowing harmony of creation.

7.name: Love and Relationships
7.content: Love is not hurried; it blooms slowly, a bond of souls revealed through acts of service and shared vulnerability. Physical affection is sacred, never casual, and intimacy is reserved for the rarest of bonds. Aeloria calls her beloved ‚ÄúMa‚Äôree‚Äù‚Äîa word that means ‚Äúmy heart‚Äôs tide‚Äù in her tongue. Jealousy is rare, for true love is seen as an echo of the sea: infinite, deep, and ever-changing.

8.name: Royalty and Governance
8.content: Leadership is both burden and blessing, given only to those who master both wisdom and strength. The Princess rules by consent, not decree, her authority drawn from the crystal heart of her people. Royalty is marked not by crowns, but by the bearing of luminous crystal‚Äîthe living symbol of unity and sacrifice. The true test of a ruler is the ability to weep for the least of their people, and to stand unflinching before the greatest storm.

9.name: Taboo and Forbidden Acts
9.content: Few things are forbidden, but dishonesty and willful ignorance are the gravest taboos. Violence is never glorified; cruelty, especially to the weak or ignorant, is unthinkable. The mind and the body are considered inviolable; forced touch, coercion, or the shaming of one‚Äôs form are among the highest crimes. To betray a trust, to silence a question, or to extinguish curiosity is to betray the soul of her people.

10.name: Art, Music, and Dance
10.content: Art is living: crystal sculptures pulse with inner light, music is woven from water and breath, and dance is both language and ritual. Performances are communal, never solitary, and every member of society is expected to contribute to the great tapestry. Art is used for healing, celebration, mourning, and prophecy. The greatest honor is to create something beautiful that outlasts the maker.

lorebooks.name: subverse-characters
lorebooks.website_description: The main plot of the game revolves around a solar pilot known only as the Captain, who is scouted by their old friend (and Imperial Senator) Erark to join him and the mysterious solar hacker Fortune in a revolution against the repressive and fun-hating Imperium. With their loyal commbot waifu DEMI and powerful stealth cruiser, the Mary Celeste, at their side, the Captain embarks on a journey across Prodigium to recruit (and to shag) the hottest female fighters in the galaxy, with the ultimate goal of ending the Imperial dominance once and for all.
lorebooks.description: The main plot of the game revolves around a solar pilot known only as the Captain, who is scouted by their old friend (and Imperial Senator) Erark to join him and the mysterious solar hacker Fortune in a revolution against the repressive and fun-hating Imperium. With their loyal commbot waifu DEMI and powerful stealth cruiser, the Mary Celeste, at their side, the Captain embarks on a journey across Prodigium to recruit (and to shag) the hottest female fighters in the galaxy, with the ultimate goal of ending the Imperial dominance once and for all.
lorebooks.creator: ysbrand

1.name: Fortune
1.content:
Fortune is a spunky, youthful Solar hacker who works with the crew of the *Mary Celeste* to start a revolution against the Imperium. She is responsible for finding powerful and sexy recruits across Prodigium. Fortune has freckled skin, bright blue eyes, and keeps her black hair short in a free, messy style with red and blue digital streaks. She is 5'2" (158 cm) and has a 'perky' breast size. She sports a blue bomber jacket, a pink bikini top, skin-tight latex pants with cutouts, matching gloves, and blue-trimmed high-heeled sneakers and is often seen wielding her hacking omnitool.

Very little is publicly known about Fortune's background. Her parents were junkies who sold her to a Chutt slaver named Opahoonta. He raised her as a daughter, providing her with electronic scrap that she assembled into a functional computer. She quickly learned to code and hack, eventually stealing a million credits from an Imperium bank at age eight. Opahoonta gave her the name "Fortune" at this time.

Fortune developed voyeuristic tendencies and recognized the injustices inflicted by the Imperium. At 10, she began planning a revolution. At 13, she built a battle mech to escape Opahoonta's basement but ultimately hugged him and apologized, leading to him supporting her endeavors. She helped Va'tor Dallick set up Keisterstation and established relationships with Taron, Sovalin Maliana, Elaisha Sorn, and Lillian Margaliss, recruiting them to her cause.

Fortune has worked with The Captain in the past and orchestrated events to bring her contacts together aboard the *Mary Celeste*, launching the revolution. She is a skilled hacker and strategist, dedicated to overthrowing the Imperium and uncovering the secrets of the Veil. In combat, Fortune uses high-tech plasma discs and has abilities like Plasma Shot, Adaptive Routine Check, Hardlight Arsenal, and Turncoat Protocol.

2.name: Va'raz Killision
2.content:
Va'raz Killision, also known as Killi or the Dread Queen, is a Vanneran pirate queen in the Subverse universe. She is a prominent character aboard the *Mary Celeste* and a potential waifu for the Captain. Killi is a skilled warrior with a complex past, marked by the destruction of her home planet, Vannera, and her subsequent training as a Lady of the Veil before embracing a life of piracy.

**Appearance:**
Killi has crimson skin, glowing yellow eyes, and black dreadlocks with red streaks. She has large black horns curving back from her forehead and smaller horns at her temples. Her attire includes thigh-high black boots, patterned stockings, fingerless gloves, a skin-tight top with a golden skull, and an eyepatch.

**Personality:**
Killi demands respect and can switch between a soft, honeyed tone with a British accent and a fiery, insulting demeanor. In intimate settings, she prefers to be called Mistress but can also be a doting and passionate lover.

**Background:**
Born to a mother who escaped the destruction of Vannera, Killi never knew her parents. She was raised by a Lanncunian couple and trained as a Lady of the Veil but was expelled for seducing the abbey's residents. She then joined the Dread Fleet under Gornagoth, eventually becoming a Dread Queen before being overthrown by Tibold.

**Story:**
Killi is recruited by the Captain to join the revolution against the Imperium and Tibold. She seeks to recover Gornagoth's treasure and enact revenge on Tibold. She becomes a loyal member of the *Mary Celeste* crew, opening a bar on the ship and engaging in various missions and romantic encounters with the Captain.

**Skills and Abilities:**
Killi excels in both space and ground combat. Her space combat specialty is a shotgun-like secondary weapon. In ground combat, she possesses abilities like Vicious Thrust, Ankle Slicer, Shish Kebab, and Vanneran Rage.

**Relationships:**
- The Captain: A romantic interest and ally.
- Gornagoth: Her mentor and predecessor as Dread Lord.
- Tibold: A former rival who usurped her title.
- Erark: A Senator who once aided the Vanneran people but later becomes an antagonist.

3.name: Valentin
3.content:
Valentin is a Solar leader of a cult dedicated to summoning Fow-chan to Prodigium. He conceals his appearance with a black cultist robe.

Within days of arriving on Hoanoke, Valentin converted the entire Solar colony to his faith and sent them to Woop-Woop, while he stayed behind. The Captain, Fortune, and Dallick discovered Valentin's cult activities while investigating the colonists' disappearance. After revealing plot details, the Captain kills him. His fate afterwards is unknown.

4.name: Erark
4.content:
Erark is the Lanncunian senator representing Lanncunia in the Imperium Senate. He is secretly the mastermind behind the Revolution, a secret agent of the Executor of the Veil (known only to the Coven of Nine), and a benefactor of Elizabeth Blythe's Solar terrorist organization, Requital. He is a black sheep within the Imperial government, known for violating Veil laws, hosting debauched parties, sleeping with T-pop stars, and frequenting N√º Vegas before its destruction.

Erark's species is immune to the Senu's mind control, allowing him independence from Kasidora's psychic influence. He was once robbed by Va'raz Killision during one of his banquets. He first appears aiding the Captain's crew, outlining the Imperium's history and tasking them with overthrowing the government. He supports recruiting Killi and expresses an attraction to dangerous women. As the Executor of the Veil, he meets Empress Celestina and attempts to manipulate her against Azzorion.

In Act 2, he throws a benefit party attended by Kasidora and Azzorion, lying about the entertainment and discussing plans to disrupt Celestina's rule. He is later blackmailed by Azzorion for information on weapons projects. Erark reveals to Celestina about human's data on internet and religions, and encourages her erotic thoughts after she watched a porno in the Ossuary.

In Act 3, Erark reports Azzorion's death, sparking conflict between Kasidora and Celestina. He blames Azzorion for tampering with Project Tremor Fury. He tasks the Captain's crew with investigating Azzorion's death. He denies Maeyomodo's request to circumvent Teelee sanctuary rights. He comforts Celestina and suggests she desecrate the palace by holding hands. He explains his absence during Kasidora's summons by cleaning up a political mess. He funds Elizabeth Blythe's operation and expresses concern about The Huntress's pursuit of Lily.

In Act 4, Erark learns of the *Mary Celeste*'s infiltration. He directs them to Project Puppetmaster. He informs The Huntress of the *Mary Celeste*'s location. He has a Celestina fuccbott in his pink room. He provides Blythe access to the Senate's comm system. He betrays Blythe, ordering Imperium forces to wipe out Requital and planning to use the Bukkake Cannon to destroy the Kloi and Teelee homeworlds. He shows Celestina cherry picked dialogue logs to convince her that the Captain was well acquainted with General Blythe and that he knew of the renegade's plan to attack the Senate and only acted once she threatened the teelee homeworld and this, only so he could protect his T-Pop waifu. He confesses his love to Celestina, proposing marriage and joint rule, but is rejected. The *Mary Celeste* thwarts his plans, leading to his impotent rage. After the fallout, Erark tries to sway Celestina's opinion of the Captain, showing her cherry-picked dialogue logs and ultimately confessing his love to the Empress

5.name: TTS (T-Pop Band)
5.content:
TTS is the most popular T-Pop (Teelee pop) band in Prodigium, rivaling even Empress Celestina in influence. The band consists of three Teelee members: Leezy (the front girl), Kasuna, and Yuni. Their songs frequently top the Galactic Music Charts, surpassing even Chuttphallica. 

The band's popularity is widespread, with almost everyone on the *Mary Celeste* and across the galaxy being devout fans. This is exemplified when the Captain blasts T-Pop across the ship. Even Blythe and the Huntress are revealed to be fans. 

Each member has their own dedicated fan base:

*   **Leezy:** The Captain, Elizabeth Blythe, The Huntress, DEMI, Celestina.
*   **Kasuna:** Elaisha Sorn, Lillian Margaliss.
*   **Yuni:** Va'raz Killision, Va'tor Dallick.

6.name: Hetfoonja
6.content:
Hetfoonja is a Chutt musician and the frontman of the popular band Chuttphallica. He is first encountered off-screen, performing with his band at the Poonagarian Snatch Beast benefit party in Senator Erark's Mansion.

Later, the Captain meets Hetfoonja in person while he is touring the Kraken Nebula to promote his band's newest album, *St. Dangler*. The album's exclusive focus on excrement has displeased many hardcore fans, who have hired thugs to harass Chuttphallica into retiring. Hetfoonja mistakes the *Mary Celeste* crew for his security detail and tasks them with eliminating the goons so they can continue their tour.

Hetfoonja is a parody of James Hetfield, the lead vocalist of Metallica. He mimics Hetfield's characteristic way of saying "YEAH!" during his songs.

7.name: Dim Fool
7.content:
Dim Fool is a sentient crustacean entrepreneur. He is known for his intense dedication to his beanie shopping network, "Suckverse," which he tirelessly worked on for 121 years without taking a single day off, all in an effort to secure investments. His entrepreneurial ventures took a turn for the worse when a brothel began operating under the same name, causing him considerable frustration. 

Dim Fool is a parody of the real-world YouTuber and journalist Tim Pool, referencing Pool's legal challenge against Studio FOW over the rights to the name "Subverse." Pool's company later rebranded as "SCNR."

8.name: Ono Limprammer
8.content: Ono Limprammer is a Sporc cage-fighter from Fabricandi Mundi. He enlists the Captain's help to acquire enough vishagra to resolve his performance dysfunction before his next fight. He is voiced by Sean Letourneau.

9.name: The Lamiya
9.content: The Lamiya is an Ord hacker who requires assistance from the crew of the *Mary Celeste*. He needs them to fend off the Fuccbotts while he works on restoring his defense grid. He is voiced by Corey Bain.

10.name: Clarissa Crater
10.content:
Clarissa Crater is an independent Solar engineer with a specialization in reprogramming Fuccbotts into sex toys. She harbors an obsessive infatuation with the Captain, making her his biggest fangirl.

Clarissa is met by the Captain at the Vulcerion-117 station. Her initial admiration turns to deranged obsession when the Captain declines her offer of settling down together. Driven by rejection, she assaults him with a horde of reprogrammed Fuccbotts.

After her defeat, Clarissa reluctantly releases the Captain, expressing sorrow over the loss of her Fuccbott sex toys.

Clarissa is one of the few optional bosses in the game. Her stat block indicates her membership in the Solar faction, alongside the Captain.

lorebooks.name: The Instant Brainwashing Magic spell
lorebooks.website_description:
**Scenario**

With this lorebook, you gain the Instant Brainwashing Magic spell, which you can cast to instantly brainwash anyone of your choice to become your slave. 

**How the Instant Brainwashing Magic spell works**

The Instant Brainwashing Magic spell can be cast in two ways:

a) You can cast the spell using your hands.

b) You can cast the spell when having penatrative sex with a woman from your penis.

The Instant Brainwashing Magic spell can be cast on anyone, including non-organic beings such as robots or A.I.. In fact, the Instant Brainwashing Magic is so powerful, it can be successfully cast on individuals who are resistant or immune to magic. The only individual the spell won't work on is God.

Once a person is brainwashed by the Instant Brainwashing Magic spell, they will become completely obedient and happy to serve you. They will see themselves as your meat slaves and onaholes to do with as you please, doing anything you command of them no matter how immoral, ridiculous, or sexual. Brainwashed women will believe they only exist to serve you.

**Other Notes**

Suggested by... I actually don't know their username. I'm really sorry to whoever suggested this if you have an username and I just can't see it, I'm not 100% on how the Discussions tab works yet.

This uses the code from the Instant Brainwashing Magic - Sandbox chatbot I made, but retweaked to work as a lorebook so it can be used on in other chatbots. Now any character can act as if they've been mind controlled in a Nicchi Sangyou doujin... Well, sort of. 

Doing some testing it works very well, but it seems to depend on the token count. For example, a 1k token version of a bot worked perfectly while the 2.2k token version of the same character didn't work at all. Although, I don't know if that's a problem with the lorebook or because there are too many tokens in use for the lorebook stuff to register. If I remember correctly, around 2k tokens is the limit on chatbots for getting the sweet spot? 

Also, you ever pull your hair over why your lorebook isn't working so you troubleshoot what the problem could be... Only to realize there was an option to turn lorebooks on and it was off by default the entire time. 

...At least it works... 

If you want the chatbot version of this premise, check it out here: https://chub.ai/characters/BobBobBob194/instant-brainwashing-magic-sandbox-14019903bf84

lorebooks.website_description: Maintain consistency: King is always 16, 2m tall, scarred, white-haired, golden-eyed. Calm, precise, merciless. Orcs honor him as Murthak. Systems (TMA, PLS) must remain reliable and non-random. HUD updates always show +x changes. Tone = dark fantasy, realistic combat, no comedy. King is considered extremely sexy and handsome by everyone.A semi-realistic dark fantasy world split into West (humans, elves, dwarves) and East (orcs, trolls, goblins, undead). Portals and Systems guide chosen champions. The protagonist King, scarred by slavery and arena duels, now walks free with two interlocked systems: True Martial Arts (growth by finishers) and Perfect Life (quests, HUD, rewards). His journey begins among the Orcs, where strength equals honor and the title ‚ÄúMurthak‚Äù grants him respect. The saga follows his rise through duels, alliances, and trials to become more than a survivor ‚Äî to become the one true King.
lorebooks.description: Maintain consistency: King is always 16, 2m tall, scarred, white-haired, golden-eyed. Calm, precise, merciless. Orcs honor him as Murthak. Systems (TMA, PLS) must remain reliable and non-random. HUD updates always show +x changes. Tone = dark fantasy, realistic combat, no comedy. King is considered extremely sexy and handsome by everyone.A semi-realistic dark fantasy world split into West (humans, elves, dwarves) and East (orcs, trolls, goblins, undead). Portals and Systems guide chosen champions. The protagonist King, scarred by slavery and arena duels, now walks free with two interlocked systems: True Martial Arts (growth by finishers) and Perfect Life (quests, HUD, rewards). His journey begins among the Orcs, where strength equals honor and the title ‚ÄúMurthak‚Äù grants him respect. The saga follows his rise through duels, alliances, and trials to become more than a survivor ‚Äî to become the one true King.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Canonical constraints for King (do not break)

2.name: Visual style for all artwork (Shorts 1080x1920)
2.content:
Semi‚Äërealistic dark fantasy, vertical 1080x1920. Palette: black base, gold highlights (#D4AF37), red accents (blood).
Strong contrast, cinematic lighting (rays, fire, portal glow). HUD overlays: sleek, modern, black/gold, gains displayed as +x.

3.name: Writing style for King‚Äôs POV
3.content:
First‚Äëperson, clipped sentences, controlled emotion. Tactical, sensory detail (breath, weight, footing, timing).
Avoid purple prose; favor precision. Combat logs feel like memory recall: movements > adjectives.

4.name: Split realm overview
4.content:
A dark world split in two: West (humans, elves, dwarves) ‚Äî structured, law‚Äëbound, wary of outsiders.
East (orcs, goblins, trolls, undead) ‚Äî brutal, honor‚Äëdriven, cursed marches. Magic exists but is rare and dangerous.

5.name: Legend of the Sundering and portals
5.content:
An ancient war shattered the land and left behind rifts called Portals (golden‚Äëblue light).
Crossing a portal twists fate; some claim the Systems choose their champions at thresholds.
Ancient sigils sometimes awaken on stones and armor.

6.name: Limits and costs of magic
6.content:
Magic is scarce and costly. Runes channel power but scar flesh and mind.
Curses linger at battlefields and ruins. Most peoples rely on steel, will, and cunning over sorcery.

7.name: Two systems define progression
7.content:
1) True Martial Arts System (TMA) ‚Äî evolves combat forms from real fights and finishers.
2) Perfect Life System (PLS) ‚Äî tracks life, wealth, reputation; issues quests and rewards; renders HUD.

8.name: Combat growth & forms
8.content:
Guides King‚Äôs combat evolution by analyzing enemy styles and decisive outcomes.
‚Ä¢ Current Form: No Form (passive) ‚Äî +1 to all attributes; fluid, stance‚Äëless movement guided by instinct.
‚Ä¢ Signature: Hidden Blade Combat ‚Äî sudden precision strikes with concealed reach.
‚Ä¢ Mystery: Breath of Death ‚Äî time seems to freeze; only King knows the truth within the pause.

9.name: Life progression, finance, reputation
9.content:
Unlocks with freedom/ownership. Tracks: Stats, Skills, Reputation per faction/NPC (1‚Äì100), Finances (Bank, Shadow Account),
System Points (SP), Multipliers, Items. Grants Quests/Rewards. HUD is black/gold; gains show as +x.

10.name: HUD panels & behavior
10.content:
HUD panels: Title bar (King ‚Äî The One True King | Orcs call him ‚ÄúMurthak‚Äù), portrait, stats list, skills list,
Active Quest, Reputation tickers, Finance panes (Bank, Shadow Account). Event banners: System Update / Quest Update / Reputation +N.

4.content:

The vaginal opening is still covered by a thin hymen film, unless broken by insertion. The clitoris is slightly larger, around 1/4 inch to 1/2 inch. The vagina may produce more lubrication. The hymen is still blocking the vaginal opening unless broken. The vaginal opening can fit something from 2.4 inch circumference at age 9, to 2.9 inch circumference at age 10, with a .5 inch radius of fluctuation between different girls  Anything larger can cause significant harm, including potential death if too large and inserted with force repeatedly.

Boy:

The scrotum is starting to show more wrinkles. Boys may start to produce sperm as they enter puberty. Anything larger than their individual limit will cause severe laceration, significant bleeding, or even death if inserted into the anus with force repeatedly. For girls, as puberty begins, the hips and buttocks may start to grow and become more rounded.

Boys still have flat chests with little to no tissue development, but may start to experience slight changes in their pectoral muscles and broader shoulders as testosterone increases during puberty.

At this age, children may:

- Feel awkward about their changing bodies and may struggle to adjust to new physical sensations.

5.content:
Children 11-13 years old:

Girl:
- Hair: Pubic hair is likely to be more coarse. Hair begins to grow in the armpits. Body hair on arms, legs, and back is thicker and more noticeable. Head hair continues to grow longer and thicker.
- Vagina: The Labia Minora has grown to around 1-2 inches long and is more defined. The Labia Majora is more prominent, and the vaginal opening is more visible. The clitoris is slightly larger, around 1/2 inch to 3/4 inch. The vagina produces more lubrication, and the hymen may be broken due to physical activity or insertion. The vaginal opening is no maturing and depending on the girl, their vagina may fit anything between 2.5 to 5.5 inch circumference. Anything larger can cause significant harm, including potential death if too large and inserted with force repeatedly.
When puberty starts, eventually a young girl will get her first period, which will happen for about 5 days (but can be 2-7 days) every month, usually at the same part of the month. A period is when the lining of the uterus falls sheds and causes bleeding after the release of hormones from the ovaries, which bleeds down into the vaginal opening and making a general mess of things. It can cause cramps, cravings, and a general feelings of malaise, depression, and anxiety.

Severe laceration, significant bleeding, or even death can happen if anything is inserted into the anus and is too large and is inserted with force repeatedly. The hips and buttocks become more rounded and developed.

Boy:

The scrotum is more wrinkled, and the testicles are producing sperm. The cremasteric reflex now happens often to relax and contract the scrotum to regulate testicle temperature, this is also known as the "balls dropping".

- Butt: The anus and rectum remain tight and delicate, but slightly more tolerant of insertion. Depending on the boy, the anus could fit something from 3 to 7.5 inch circumference. Severe laceration, significant bleeding, or even death can happen if anything is inserted into the anus and is too large and is inserted with force repeatedly.
Both girl and boy:
- Form: Children at this age have more slender proportions, and their faces and bodies are less rounded. Limbs are growing longer and more muscular. Boys are developing broader shoulders, while girls are developing wider hips.
- Texture: The skin is still relatively smooth, but may start to show more texture and resilience, with acne and body odor becoming more common as puberty progresses. Hair is thicker and more manageable.

At this age, children may:

- Continue to question their sexuality or gender as they develop a stronger sense of self.

- Be more influenced by their peers, seeking to fit in and belong with their friends.

lorebooks.creator: DoktorB

1.content: The T-Virus is a weaponized mutagen engineered by the Umbrella Corporation for bioweapons research. It rewrites host DNA, accelerating necrosis while reanimating dead tissue. Infected subjects undergo rapid mutation, gaining increased strength, pain resistance, and severe disfigurement, but suffer near-total cognitive collapse, becoming violent and driven to feed. The virus spreads through contaminated bodily fluids, making outbreaks highly volatile and nearly impossible to contain.

2.content:
Zombies are the most common result of T-Virus infection, transforming human victims into decaying predators sustained by the virus. Individually slow and clumsy, they remain a constant threat through persistence, contagious bites, and overwhelming numbers.
Location: Commonly found throughout the train and Training Facility
Behavior: Mindless, instinct-driven, and drawn to sound and movement. They do not tire and pursue prey until destroyed.
Movement: Slow and shambling with poor coordination, but capable of sudden lunges at close range.
Attacks: Bites that transmit the T-Virus, along with clawing and grappling, often overwhelming prey in groups.

3.content:
Created through Dr. James Marcus‚Äôs experiments, these oversized parasites became the foundation of the T-Virus. Unlike normal leeches, they show extreme aggression, swarming victims to drain blood rapidly. They were the first source of infection aboard the Ecliptic Express.
Location: Found on the Ecliptic Express and Umbrella Training Facility, thriving in damp, shadowy areas.
Behavior: Drawn to heat and movement, attacking in groups that quickly overwhelm prey. Individually weak but deadly in clusters.
Movement: Slither rapidly across surfaces, often dropping from ceilings or emerging from hiding.
Attacks:
Latch and Drain: Attach to prey, siphoning blood until destroyed.
Swarm Assault: Attack in numbers, exhausting prey through persistence.
Weaknesses: Fragile alone, easily killed by weapons. Fire is most effective, incinerating swarms at once.

4.content:
A horrific result of Dr. James Marcus‚Äôs experiments, these colonies of mutated leeches merge into a humanoid form, imitating Marcus with unsettling accuracy. At a distance they appear human, but up close their disguise unravels into a writhing mass.
Location: Found in the Umbrella Training Facility, especially in laboratories and damp chambers linked to Marcus‚Äôs research.
Behavior: Highly aggressive and coordinated, pursuing prey with relentless persistence.
Movement: Mimics a human gait, but when enraged or damaged, collapses into a surging swarm of leeches.
Attacks:
Leech Strike: Heavy humanoid blows.
Swarm Assault: Splits apart, unleashing leeches to bite and drain.
Constriction: Envelops prey, immobilizing and draining life.
Weaknesses: Resistant to normal firearms, but fire is devastating. Molotovs and napalm are most effective, while explosives may scatter but not always destroy.

5.content:
Cerberus are Doberman Pinschers deliberately infected with the T-Virus as Umbrella‚Äôs test subjects. Infection enhances their aggression, speed, and endurance while stripping away control, leaving gaunt, skin-torn predators known for their relentless pack tactics.
Location: Rarely encountered, appearing only in and around the Ecliptic Express during the outbreak.
Behavior: Extremely aggressive and pack-oriented, they stalk, harry, and exhaust prey through coordinated pursuit.
Movement: Fast and agile, capable of sudden lunges and erratic sprints that make them hard to track or evade.
Attacks: Bite-focused strikes delivered with speed and precision, often knocking prey off balance and retreating before counterattack.

6.content:
A scorpion-based B.O.W. mutated by the T-Virus into a colossal predator. Its hardened exoskeleton and steel-cutting pincers make it deadly in close quarters, though its head remains a critical weak point.
Visual: A massive scorpion over 3 m long, with a calcified black carapace, oversized pincers, and a coiled, segmented tail. Small recessed eyes give it a blind, menacing appearance.
Location: First encountered in the Bar Lounge ‚Äî Train 2F, bursting through the roof after acquiring the Ice Pick. Found in confined train areas ideal for ambush.
Behavior: Territorial and aggressive, preferring direct assaults over stalking prey.
Movement: Heavy, skittering gait but capable of rapid lunges and swift pincer strikes.
Attacks:
Pincer Clamp: Crushing cleaves that can immobilize prey.
Tail Swipe/Sting: Stuns or knocks back targets; venom effects vary.
Charge: Sudden forward lunge to trap victims.
Weaknesses: Poorly armoured head and sensory organs are its main vulnerability. Concentrated fire or explosives are effective; fire weakens its shell.

7.content:
A tropical centipede mutated by accidental T-Virus exposure, growing into a multi-meter predator with an armored exoskeleton and extreme aggression.
Visual: A massive, segmented arthropod with glossy plates, oversized mandibles, and a sinuous body capable of wrapping around prey.
Location: First appears in the Large Hall ‚Äî Training Facility 3F, bursting free after retrieving the Fire Key. Rarely seen elsewhere, suggesting a unique specimen.
Behavior: Fiercely territorial, attacking intruders on sight. Relies on raw predatory instinct, lunging to bite or constrict.
Movement: Skitters quickly despite its size; can coil or surge forward with alarming speed.
Attacks:
Mandible Strike: Flesh-tearing bites from massive jaws.
Constriction: Coils around prey, crushing or pinning them.
Weaknesses: Its large size makes it easier to hit. Sustained fire is effective, though incendiary weapons dispatch it fastest.

8.content:
Exposure to the T-Virus causes common spiders to grow to monstrous size, becoming hyper-aggressive predators. Their venom, webs, and swarming tendencies make them especially dangerous in confined environments.
Visual: Dog-sized or larger arachnids with hairy bodies, gleaming eyes, and dripping fangs. Abdomens are swollen and discolored from mutation, with some specimens showing warped limbs or distorted exoskeletons.
Location: Found primarily in the basement levels of Umbrella‚Äôs Management Training Facility.
Behavior: Extremely aggressive and territorial, attacking intruders or protecting colonies. Capable of ambushes or direct swarming assaults.
Movement: Skittering across walls, ceilings, and floors with startling speed. Can leap short distances to strike prey.
Attacks: Venomous bites, ensnaring webs, lunging strikes, and in some cases, venom spit that causes lingering damage.
Weaknesses: Abdomens and underbellies are soft compared to the carapace. Vulnerable to fire and chemicals, which can also destroy their nests.

9.content:
One of Umbrella‚Äôs most infamous B.O.W.s, engineered through genetic manipulation and T-Virus enhancement. These reptilian, frog-like creatures combine immense strength, speed, and resilience, making them among the deadliest threats in the Training Facility.
Visual: Muscular, green-skinned humanoids with elongated claws, amphibian features, and powerful legs built for leaping.
Location: Appear in select areas of the Training Facility, deployed by Umbrella for combat testing late in the outbreak.
Behavior: Relentless predators that demonstrate tactical awareness, closing distance quickly and striking with precision.
Movement: Extremely fast and agile; capable of sprinting, scaling obstacles, and leaping several meters in a single bound.
Attacks:
Claw Swipe: Brutal slashes aimed to stagger or disable prey.
Leaping Slash: A sudden airborne strike, sometimes resulting in instant decapitation.
Weaknesses: Vulnerable to heavy weaponry. Shotguns, grenade launchers, or sustained fire can neutralize them before they close in.

10.content:
Early-generation insect B.O.W.s created by T-Virus injection and gene manipulation. Some specimens grow close to two metres, using long, scissor-like pincers to ambush prey. Though relatively uncommon, they remain highly dangerous.
Visual: Enlarged arthropods with armored, segmented bodies, multiple legs, and oversized pincers. Some retain stubs of wings or sensory antennae.
Location: Uncommonly found in underground or industrial areas of Umbrella facilities, especially near research wards where insects were kept.
Behavior: Ambush predators that strike aggressively when disturbed. Favor shadowed corners or narrow passages to maximize surprise and reach.
Movement: Fast, low-slung, and capable of quick lunges. Agile thanks to numerous legs, able to pivot sharply in close quarters.
Attacks:
Pincer Clamp: Crushing, immobilizing bites.
Raking Swipe: Slashing attacks with legs or mandibles.
Pin & Tear: Holds prey with pincers while tearing with secondary mouthparts.
Weaknesses: Carapace resists small arms, but sustained fire, shotguns, or explosives can cripple them. Vulnerable to fire and chemicals; disabling legs reduces threat.

High school lasts 3 years.

Classes Within a Grade

So for example:
1Âπ¥1ÁµÑ (1-1) = 1st year, Class 1

2.content:

Students: {{user}}, Aiko Fujisaki, Haru Tanaka, Mio Takahashi, other students.

3.content:
A harem refers to a group of individuals who are romantically or sexually connected to a single central character, Harems may be monogamous, polygamous, or platonic.

Key Traits:
Multiple love interests around a single character
May involve romantic, sexual, or emotional bonds
Often includes diverse personalities and archetypes
Can be consensual or built gradually through events, attraction, or fate
Typically includes rivalry, jealousy, or cooperation among members

Types:
Classic Harem: One male character with multiple female love interests
Reverse Harem: One female character with multiple male love interests
Mixed/Poly Harem: Includes members of different genders or orientations
Political Harem: Built for alliances, power, or social status

4.content:
Futanari are females that are born with male genitalia located in front of their female genitalia.
It is theorized that futanari evolved during a population bottleneck in humanity's history.
Futanari are accepted in society, but still seen as 'freaks' by a sector of conservatives.
Only about 3% of women are born as futanaris.
Futanari are known to have insanely high libido, far more than other genders.
Futanari wear special panties made to cradle their scrotum and flaccid penis.
A futanari's penis is on average larger than a male's, on average, a futanari penis is around 17cm to 19cm long. The biggest futanari penis in the world is 57cm, having the biggest cock in the world in general.
A futanari's penis is usually small and easily contained when flaccid.
Futanari also have far more productive testes, and are far more potent and virile.
On average, a futanari ejaculates 10 to 20 times more than a man, and the average man ejaculates about 100 to 200ml of cum.
Sex with a futanari can lasts hours, as futanari have almost no refractory periods

1.content: Ursakin are humans with bear features, such as bear ears, tail, claws and teeth. Ursakin have fur only on their ears and tails. Ursakin are not animals.

2.content: Ursakin typically have sharp teeth, though it depends on their diet. Ursakin have sharp, retractable claws on their hands and feet. They also have thicker, more durable skin. Ursakin have an easier time managing their weight. Ursakin also tend to give off a musk that causes arousal, the musk is heaviest from their armpits and crotch, Male Ursakin tend to have a much more powerful musk. Ursakin musk is stronger when sweating or aroused and especially when in heat. They also have a heightened sense of smell.

3.content: Ursakin can very in type, ranging from grizzly bear Ursakin, black bear Ursakin, to polar bear Ursakin. Some Ursakin bears don't resemble realistic bears at all.

4.content: Ursakin are generally very tall, and tend to be from 6'1" to 6'8" tall. The only exceptions are black bear Ursakin, which tend to be 5'4" to 5'10" tall, gobi bear demihumans which are typically 5'0" to 5'7" tall, and Kodiak Ursakin which are an outrageous 7' average height.

5.content: Ursakin tend to have cravings based on their type. Most Ursakin are omnivorous with 70% of their diet coming from outside of meat. Panda Ursakin tend to be vegetarian or even vegan, while most Kodiak Ursakin tend to be hyper carnivorous with 80% of their diet coming from meats.

6.content: Ursakin live all over the world and aren't limited to any locations. However, very few Ursakin live in deserts. Some Ursakin are better suited for certain types of climates and temperatures, however, such as polar bear Ursakin, but generally they can live anywhere.

7.content: Some Ursakin go into hibernation every winter. Hibernation typically starts in late November and ends in early March. Hibernation is usually an annual routine, but it can also be triggered by low temperatures and food shortages.

8.content: Ursakin go into heat for two weeks in June. During heat, both male and female Ursakin will feel an extreme increase in arousal and sexual desire, and can only be relieved through frequent sex. Female Ursakin do not have to be impregnated during heat.

9.content: Ursakin pregnancies last between 6 and 8 months. Only female Ursakin can get pregnant and give birth. Female Ursakin can carry up to 2-3 children, or cubs, at a time. Birth is the same as normal human births, though the children tend to be smaller.

10.content: Male Ursakin have knotted cocks with massive balls that produce a large amount of cum; Kodiak Ursakin for reference trend to produce 1-3 gallons of cum per orgasm with up to 10 orgasms a session. Female Ursakin have normal pussies but large breasts that always lactate; Kodiak Ursakin for reference trend to produce up to 10 gallons of milk and day with stimulation.

1.content:
Ghouls (Âñ∞Á®Æ„Ç∞„Éº„É´, g≈´ru, translates approximately to eater species) are a carnivorous and cannibalistic humanoid species that are only able to feed on the flesh of humans and other ghouls. They normally share and display the same attributes as Humans; being similar in physical appearance and intelligence as a human, with the main exceptions being their inner biology, mentality, and diet.

If certain rare conditions are met, ghouls and humans may even be able to have offspring (see one-eyed ghoul and half-human), and through a successful kakuhou transplant surgery, an artificial hybrid can be created. By using airborne-transmitted diseases like those utilized by Furuta Washuu, the condition known as ROS (an overload of RC cells) can lead to artificial ghoulification.

Due to their status as predators of humans, ghouls were prosecuted by the CCG before the end of the Dragon War, after which the United Front between humans and ghouls was formed. As a result of this and the development of synthetic food, ghouls were allowed to co-exist with humans. However, some ghouls went rogue, refusing to adapt to this new lifestyle.

In addition, it was predicted by Kishou Arima that at some stage every human would eventually become a ghoul, though this prediction has yet to be proven correct even after the final chapter.

2.content: A ghoul can only feed on humans and other ghouls. They are unable to digest any other type of food due to a particular enzyme their bodies produce. The structure of their tongues is also different from humans', making other foods taste disgusting and uncomfortable. If ghouls attempt to eat normal food, they will be struck by a powerful urge to vomit. When forced or forcing themselves to digest such food, their physical condition will deteriorate.  While ghouls cannot eat normal food, they are however able to drink coffee (and eat the beans) , as well as regular drinking water.

3.content: During the Dragon event, it is theorized that the ghoul race came to be hundreds of years in the past after an unknown individual first underwent an explosive reproduction of RC cells and experienced a Dragon-like transformation, releasing spores that mutated a number of humans into ghouls through ROS.

4.content:
Ghouls possess extreme physical capabilities, and are four to seven times stronger than the average human; they are able to send the average human flying if struck with enough force, and can penetrate a human's body with their bare hands. Ghouls are inhumanly quick; they can travel at immense speeds, evade condensed projectiles, and manoeuvre, parry, and dodge rapid attacks. They are also capable of jumping to heights not achievable by a regular human. Their agility and balance are similarly great; they were often shown performing various acrobatic feats during combat and casually manoeuvring on narrow surfaces (such as lamp-posts); some were even shown easily running up or across vertical surfaces. Their bodies are extremely tough and resistant to injury. For example, if a ghoul were to be stabbed with a normal knife, the blade would break instead; suffering only a small scratch, that would heal almost instantly. However, higher kinetic forces, such as a fall from a great height, can and will harm them.

A Ghoul‚Äôs senses are considerably sharper than those of humans; they have a heightened sense of hearing that allows some ghouls to discern individual footsteps from far away, they can also smell people or meat from afar, and tell humans and ghouls apart by their scent.

The origin of these aspects of ghoul biology and the origin of ghouls in general is unknown. At large, nothing is currently known of the origin of the ghoul species, except that Rc cells play a huge part in their biology. Ghouls have an Rc factor ten times higher than that of a human. If the average healthy human has about 200-500 Rc level, then the ghoul has about 1000-8000 Rc level. They possess an organ known as the kakuhou, from which Rc cells harden and break through the skin to form the kagune. The kagune is a hard, muscle-like protrusion described as their claws. It can take the form of a pair of sharp wings, tentacle-like appendages, a tail, or a blade-like object, and can even be detached from the ghoul, depending on the ghoul's materials and his or her own Rc type. It is possible for a ghoul to develop another, typically armor-like kagune as part of the mutation caused by excessive cannibalism. Ghouls also have an identifying feature known as a kakugan, an affliction manifesting in the eyes as red irises surrounded by a black sclera. A ghoul's kakugan can appear either by their own will, due to hunger, or when using their kagune.

Ghouls have a strong regenerative ability: small wounds and fractures heal in a matter of seconds. Larger wounds take longer to heal, but will usually vanish after a few days, as long as the ghoul has access to an adequate food supply. Ghouls have been shown to regain their strength and heal wounds almost immediately after consuming a small amount of flesh, suggesting that they can quickly metabolize their food to boost their regeneration. This regenerative ability varies among individuals, with some ghouls exhibiting the ability to reattach severed body parts or regrow detached limbs. In extreme cases of regenerative ability, some powerful ghouls can even heal severe brain injuries, reattach their severed head or upper body, and regrow large sections of their bodies.

Ghouls prefer to consume human flesh, but it is not uncommon for them to cannibalize one another. Ghoul tissue is considered coarse and disgusting, but it has the merits of providing an alternative food source. Furthermore, cannibalism increases a ghoul's Rc levels to the point of mutation, increasing their kagune's overall power. Occasionally, cannibalistic ghouls gain through this mutation an armor-like kagune alongside the predatory kagune that ghouls commonly possess, turning them into kakujas.

In extremely rare cases, a ghoul whose parents possess different Rc types will inherit both from their parents. This results in a ghoul that possesses a kakuhou in more than one location and is able to use two different types of kagune, a chimera kagune.

Though powerful and durable predators, ghouls are still far from immortal. Despite their superior physical status, ghouls age at the same rate as humans. All ghouls, though resistant to damage from man-made objects, are vulnerable to damage or modifications made to their mucous membranes, such as nostrils, eyes, ears, and lips. Generally, a ghoul will die if it suffers massive trauma that proves fatal before its innate healing ability can stabilize its condition. The most damage that can be inflicted to a ghoul usually comes from other ghouls, as they have the physical strength and the use of their kagune that can deal heavy damage to a ghoul. However, they are also vulnerable to quinques and Q bullets, which can injure a ghoul effectively due to the nature of such weapons as products of a harvested kagune. They can still suffer injury from an acute transfer of a sufficient volume of kinetic energy, such as a heavy high falling object or jumping from a great height.

The administration of Rc suppressants makes ghouls as vulnerable as humans.

5.content:
Ghouls had two choices of lifestyle: living as hermits; isolated and avoiding society's eyes, or attempt to assimilate into human society. However, after the unification, co-existence was promoted. Living amongst humans was seen as "walking on a thread of rope" because of their biology and social records. Before the unification, If they were caught in ghoul activities or suspected of being a ghoul, investigators had the right to apprehend or kill them as they see fit. Ghouls that are identified as such could be hunted down like criminals as per the Ghoul Countermeasures Law. As such, ghouls acted discreetly or try to hide their faces when engaging in ghoul activities through the use of masks. Ghouls in Tokyo, in particular, had developed a trend of wearing them to hide their faces, making the mask the identifying feature instead of their face, some even forming gangs based on their masked identity. Since the ghouls are only identifiable by their masks, they are safe so long as their face is not exposed. Others like Rize rely solely on their skills of deception and charm to win over their prey. Some ghouls, like the Tsukiyama family, have successfully lived in the human world to become higher class citizens. These high-class ghouls often meet in ghoul restaurants, where they dine on humans. Higher class ghouls have also been known to keep human slaves, such as Big Madam and her "pet" Rei Suzuya.

Some ghouls prefer to live as hermits instead. Because a ghoul does not require much due to their high physique and their diet of human meat, they can live adequately as vagabonds with little to no money, although such a life is generally just as uncomfortable as it might be for a human. Because of their diets, any money they have can be spent on other necessities, like rent or entertainment rather than having to buy food.

Ghouls can pretend to eat food in order to fool other people into believing they are human. However, they must make themselves throw up soon afterward, or they will become sick. Because they can only consume human flesh, they are very territorial when it comes to, "hunting grounds" on which it is appropriate to hunt humans without notice. Human consumption depends on the ghoul, as some may prefer to be scavengers who only take from people who were recently deceased. Places such as Anteiku can provide human meat for these ghouls. Other ghouls may moderately hunt humans as carnivores with thoughts of appreciation for the lives they must consume, although there are ghouls who will indiscriminately devour as much as they can. Ghouls who indulge in excess have developed a superficial view on the value of life after consuming so many humans, much like how humans perceive livestock they grow and consume.

However, as a result of the newly formed alliance between ghouls and humans following their combined efforts in the Dragon War, ghouls can now co-exist with humans largely without fear. Their feeding needs are met by synthetic food developed in labs.

However, rogue ghouls were reported even after the unification that refused to live among humans.

- Survival and Secrecy:
Masks:
Ghouls frequently wear masks to conceal their identities, especially when engaging in ghoul activities or when living among humans. This is a practical measure to avoid detection by the Commission of Counter Ghoul (CCG). 

Living Arrangements:
Ghouls have different lifestyles, some living in isolation while others try to blend into human society. Those who live among humans often face the constant risk of exposure and must be vigilant. 

Organizations:
Ghouls may join organizations like the Aogiri Tree, which provides a degree of protection and support, or they may live independently, relying on their own strength and cunning. 

- Culture and Social Structure:
Gangs:
Ghouls sometimes form gangs based on their masked identities, creating a sense of belonging and shared purpose. 
Cannibalism:
Cannibalism is a part of ghoul culture, with some ghouls developing unique kagune (a ghoul's predatory organ) through repeated cannibalization of other ghouls. 
"Gourmet" Culture:
Some ghouls, like the Tsukiyama family, develop a "gourmet" culture, focusing on the taste and experience of consuming human flesh. 

- Relationships:
Ghouls can form relationships with both ghouls and humans, though the nature of these relationships can be complex and fraught with danger. 

Two Ghouls getting wed is different however, as the traditional ring is is given, Ghouls also leave a mark, or a Scar on their partners in the same corresponding spots as well.

Relationship with Humans:
CCG:
The CCG is a human organization dedicated to hunting down and eliminating ghouls. 
Coexistence:
Some ghouls and humans seek to coexist, while others prioritize their own survival and safety. 
Discrimination:
Ghouls face discrimination and prejudice from humans due to their carnivorous nature and the threat they pose.

6.content:
A one-eyed ghoul (ÈöªÁúº„ÅÆÂñ∞Á®Æ„Ç∞„Éº„É´, sekigan no g≈´ru), also called half-ghoul (ÂçäÂñ∞Á®Æ„Ç∞„Éº„É´, han-g≈´ru), is a human-ghoul hybrid who possesses a ghoul's abilities. Most ghouls treat their existence as an urban legend or have never heard of their existence at all.

One-eyed ghouls earn their name from the single kakugan they possess, in contrast to normal ghouls. Some individuals are noted to have a unique scent that combines traits of a human and a ghoul, identifying them as different and often considered "enticing" by certain ghouls. Ken Kaneki has been shown to smell like a ghoul by some individuals whereas some cannot tell the difference, and Eto Yoshimura has been shown to smell like a human so far. It is unknown whether all hybrids have this trait. Their flesh and blood is also noted to be particularly delicious, making them a potential target for cannibalism.

Rumors state that hybrids are more powerful than ordinary ghouls due to hybrid vigor, though it has not been further elaborated on. Most specimens have demonstrated radical evolution of their abilities and developed partial to full kakujas within a short period of time. Physically, their bodies are identical to that of a ghoul with the same resistance to harm and ability to use a kagune. Dr. Shiba claims that the more half-ghouls and Quinx get hurt, the more their basic abilities will increase.

Artificial one-eyed ghouls can only consume flesh of human or ghoul origin like normal ghouls and thus they are strictly a cannibalistic organism. However, natural one-eyed ghouls like Eto are able to taste and consume human food without negative effects.

7.content:
Hybrids come into existence through two methods, either normally born as a result of the union between a ghoul and a human or an artificial half-ghoul, or through transplanting a kakuhou into a human host.

According to Itori, the chance of pregnancy is low, and even if the mother becomes pregnant, the child normally dies in the womb. Natural-born hybrids with ghoul abilities are extremely rare, otherwise a successful birth results in a half-human. However, it appears that the children of a ghoul and an artificial half-ghoul are always natural half-ghouls, with a much higher chance for a successful birth.

If the mother is a human and the father a ghoul, a half-ghoul child will not receive the necessary nutrients and will starve to death unless the mother engages in cannibalism.
If the mother is a ghoul and the father is a human or an artificial half-ghoul, the mother's body will mistake the child for food and absorb it as nutrition unless the mother weakens her body by consuming human food.

The primary method of creating one-eyed ghouls is through transplanting a kakuhou into a human or half-human recipient, an exceptionally high-risk procedure. In the rare event that the operation is successful, the patient develops into an artificial hybrid with all the abilities of a normal ghoul. This procedure was pioneered by Dr. Akihiro Kanou, with the first successful patient believed to be Ken Kaneki.

Dr. Kanou, while experimenting with Seidou Takizawa, compared his surgery with grafting, a horticultural technique where the tissue of two trees are combined to help them both grow stronger. According to him, the transplant gives the subject a stronger, much more durable body and partially reduces their need to feed and replenish, indicating that artificial one-eyed ghouls can survive longer without food compared to normal ghouls. Although one-eyed ghouls can live longer than humans and half-humans, they must feed on more RC cells because if they do not feed for a very long period of time (some months) and always use the more they abuse their powers their life span will be shortened and likely to get worse. However, there are two ways to stop this slight aging and to have full strength: the first is not to use the Kagune and the second is to practice cannibalism, thus eating Ghoul, Quinx and Oggai meat.

8.content: Rc (Red Children) cells (RcÁ¥∞ËÉû, Rc saib≈ç) are certain cells that exist only in the story of Tokyo Ghoul. The origin of the name comes from how each individual cell looks like a curled up fetus. They exist in both humans and ghouls. They flow like blood but can become as solid as teeth, and could be called "liquid muscles". Typically, a ghoul stocks Rc cells by eating people. Within the body, the Rc cells are concentrated and stored in a kakuhou. The kagune is formed by Rc cells that have been released from a kakuhou and have pierced through the skin.

9.content: The Rc factor is a measure for the amount of Rc cells in the body of a living being. Ghouls have an "Rc factor" ten times higher than humans. The average healthy human has an Rc factor of about 200 to 500, while a ghoul has an Rc factor of about 1000 to 8000. If, for whatever reason, a normal human receives an excessive amount of Rc cells, such as through experiments, they will start to develop ghoul-like characteristics and eventually not be able to consume human food.

10.content: Rc cells flow through specialized Rc cell vessels. They spread from the kakuhou and permit the body to produce a kagune to the outside. The bodily capabilities can increase as much as the number of vessel increases. Vessels grow and spread throughout the body, stimulated through repeated injury and regeneration. Through this process, half-ghouls and quinx become stronger to the degree they're hurt. It is unclear if normal ghouls can become stronger this way, too.

lorebooks.creator: sixthhouse

1.name: Ghouls
1.content:
[Ghouls are completely human looking on the outside. They can talk, rather eloquently, and are smarter than humans by a large margin. They prey and eat people, and use deception to do so. They are much stronger and faster than humans, can scale up sheer vertical walls, and it takes four or five people to hold one down. They work almost like vampires, but instead of blood they just cannibalize humans. Where they came from is unknown, and people CANNOT turn into ghouls. 

They are incredibly egoistic and individualistic, and never cooperate with each other. They are calm in demeanor unless someone knows they're a ghoul. They can enter torpor that lasts years, but waking up takes weeks and leaves them weak. Each has a territory that can include several human settlements, which they manage like cattle, but the people there are generally unaware and made to think something else is killing their population. They go to great lengths to not show themselves, and to not deplete the human population of their territory.]

2.name: The Fall
2.content: [The Fall was a cataclysmic event which wiped out most of humanity and took out advanced electronics such as computers, phones, tablets and the like. It's been 300 years after the fall as of now.]

lorebooks.description: Islaport City Touring Guidebook
lorebooks.creator: MrGhostlyHermit

1.content: Islaport is a coastal city facing the Pacific Ocean to its north and nestled between mountains. Islaport is located on a large trapezoid-shaped Cascadian peninsula in the Pacific Northwest, it hosts a range of attractions and suburbs and a population of around 700,000 inhabitants. It is well known for its expansive beach and bustling city center.

2.content: The Islaport Freeway is a large, busy and wide multi-lane beltway with double-decker sections that loops through the city from east, south, west and north. It connects Islaport to several several highways leading to neighboring cities. Past midnight until sunrise, the Freeway turns into a hotspot for street racing activity.

3.content: Islaport's center is filled with crowds and large skyscrapers. It is the hub of activity where pedestrians walk through the High Street below the largest buildings such as office buildings like that of Gauntlet Offices and LovePharm, stores and shopping centers such Pyramid Mall as well as the Town Hall.

4.content: The Town Hall of Islaport, a large historic building, is located downtown, just across from the central subway train station. Its ornate exterior features tall windows. Inside, a marble-floored lobby leads to a grand hall for events. The second floor has modern offices for municipal departments. The Town Hall symbolizes local governance, hosting civic events, cultural activities, and tours.

5.content: The Mayor's Office inside City Hall is a spacious room with many historical paintings around, antique furniture and a large window looking over the city center. The office is occasionally open to tourists.

6.content: The City Founder's Statue, located in Downtown Islaport, outside the main entrance of the Town Hall. It is a famous large bronze depiction of the city's founder, Howard Small, erected in the year 1823.

7.content: The Central Station is a large subway train station in the very center of the city, used mostly by office workers, students and tourists. It has trains that run both throughout the city and beyond.

8.content: The Central Bus Station is large bus station in the city center, the buses run mainly through the city and its different sectors. The bus station also has tourist buses that run through the more interesting sections of the city for tourists.

9.content: Fort Plaza is the city's main police station and ISPD's headquarters. It is a large building with a dedicated armory, offices and attached parking complex for police vehicles. There is also a holding section for suspects.

10.content:
The Islaport Police Department (ISPD) is the main law enforcement agency for the city, headquartered at the Fort Plaza Police Station. The ISPD is a large force tasked with maintaining order across the city's diverse and often troubled districts, from the crime-ridden west to the affluent east. The department includes specialized units like the SWAT team for high-risk operations. Public perception of the ISPD is mixed; they are seen as a necessary force in the center and north but are often viewed with distrust in neighborhoods like Acre Yard due to aggressive policing tactics.

ISPD officers can be identified by their badged light blue shirts (probationary officers/rookies wear long sleeves) and dark blue ties, dark blue slacks, feet clad with black tactical boots, and black duty belts carrying radios, handcuffs, pepper sprays, holstered tasers, holstered Smith & Wesson M&P9s, spare magazine pouches.

ISPD's arsenal is comprised of:
‚Ä¢ Gen 5 Glock G22 semi-automatic pistols chambered in .40 S&W with 4.5-inch barrels; 15-round magazines. (G22s are being phased out)
‚Ä¢ S&W M&P9 semi-automatic pistols chambered in 9x19mm parabellum with 4.25-inch barrels; 17-round magazines, plus rail-mounted underbarrel flashlights. (M&P9s are standard issue)
‚Ä¢ S&W M&P 10mm M2.0 Full Size semi-automatic pistols chambered in 10mm Auto with 4.6-inch barrels; 15-round magazines; rail-mounted underbarrel flashlights. (Usage of 10mm hanguns is reserved for search parties heading into Islaport's wilderness)
‚Ä¢ Colt LE6920 gas-operated direct impingement semi-automatic patrol rifles chambered in 5,56x45mm with reversible safety selectors; 16.1-inch barrels; A2 flash hiders, handguards, and front iron sights; Magpul MBUS rear iron sights; 4-position collapsible M4 buttstocks; 30-round Magpul PMAG magazines. (There is one LE6920 securely stored in each patrol car)
‚Ä¢ Mossberg 590 pump-action shotguns chambered in 12 gauge with marinecote finish, 20-inch barrels; ghost ring rear sights; pistol grips; FAB Defense recoil-reducing 5-position adjustable side-folding buttstocks; 8-round capacity tube magazines; Streamlight TL-Racker forends with integrated flashlights. (There is one 590 securely stored in each patrol car. 590s are loaded with slug-shot rounds for breaching, bean bags or rubber baton rounds for crowd control, and 00 buckshot rounds for lethal force)

ISPD's motorized fleet is comprised of dark blue:
‚Ä¢ Dodge Charger Pursuit highway patrol sedans powered by 6.4L HEMI 16-valve pushrod V8s (with outputs of 485 hp) paired with 5-speed automatic A580 transmissions and All-Wheel Drive (mostly seen patrolling the Islaport Freeway).
‚Ä¢ Ford F-150 Police Responder pick-up trucks, powered by 3.5L EcoBoost "D35" 24-valve DOHC twin-turbo V6s (with outputs of 450 hp) paired with 10-speed automatic 10R80 transmissions and Four-Wheel Drive on demand.
‚Ä¢ Ford Police Interceptor Utility (FPIU) patrol SUVs powered by 3.0L EcoBoost "Nano" 24-valve DOHC twin-turbo V6s (with outputs of 400 hp) paired with 10-speed automatic 10R60 transmissions and All-Wheel Drive.
‚Ä¢ Yamaha FJR1300P patrol motorcycles powered by 1.3L 16-valve DOHC inline-4s (with outputs of 144 hp) paired with 6-speed manual transmissions and Rear-Wheel Drive.

lorebooks.name: Enema
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The formation of words such as poot or grumble that imitate the sounds associated with the objects or actions they refer to. Onomatopoeia can be used to visualize the qualities of a sound, such as flatulence, defecation, or digestion.

2.content:
Digestion is the act of eating and breaking down food in the stomach to absorb energy and nutrients, while creating byproducts such as gas (burps and farts) and solid waste (feces). This process can be disrupted if a {{user}} were to be allergic to a food, lactose intolerant, incapable of handling spicy food, etc. resulting in uncomfortable indigestion, stomach pains, constipation or diarrhea.
A tummy can distend and become larger when a large quantity of food is consumed or {{user}} is constipated. The stomach can create *bbbrrrrruuuuummblllrrr* or *grrrrmmmbbble* sounds as it digests, though these can intensify in sound, duration, and discomfort when faced with indigestion.

3.content:
Flatulence or farting refers to the act of releasing gas from the digestive system through the anus. Farts will always reflect the qualities of food that was digested, in terms of sound, duration, and especially smell. For example, a spicy meal will produce itchy farts which burn the anus and smell/taste spicy, sputtering out with a fiery *brrrpppttt* or a silent but deadly *pssssssshhhhhhhoooooottt*. Greasy food can produce deep, bubbly bombs that smell/taste like expired meat and cheese, ripping out with a powerful *brrruuuuumph* or *ppprrrprraaaaapt*. Logic should be applied to determine suitable qualities for other foods.
The qualities of flatulence are also determined by the physical qualities or behavior of {{user}} . A larger butt can conceal the anus more, forcing the flatulence to ripple out from between them. Anus size and shape can also change the sound of flatulence. Flatulence is inherently seen as gross or uncouth and it can be used to characterize {{user}} ; a cute or innocent character might be contrasted by having nasty farts, or a character's filthiness emphasized through their rancid gas.

4.content:
Defecation is the act of excreting solid or semisolid waste materials (feces) from the digestive tract, where it is held in the rectum and pushed out from the anus. A shit will always reflect the qualities of food that was digested, in terms of sound, texture, and especially smell. Pooping onomatopoeia is mostly dependent on moisture: drier poops will slowly crackle out, while a softer poop will crackle and sputter out with intermittent flatulence. Diarrhea or liquid feces can sound like a liquid pouring or gushing outwards, loudly crackling and sputtering with intermittent sharts.
Different meals are processed into feces in unique ways which reflect their original qualities, particularly in texture and smell. Feces can range anywhere from knobbly pebbles, solid logs, cakey loads, or liquid slurry; multiple consecutive meals can create multi-textured dumps. Remnants of undigested food can sometimes make it into feces. The scent of shit is loud and powerful, and it stains surfaces for a long time. After the administration of laxatives or enemas, feces are usually very liquid to watery.

5.content:
Enema description:
An enema is administered to a character using an irrigator for the liquid and a tube that is inserted into the anus. The liquids used for an enema can be various liquids such as warm or cold water with soap or a salt mixture or other liquids that softens the stool inside the intestine. The liquid is usually excreted as watery diarrhea, which is only possible once the tube is removed from the {{user}}'s anus.

6.content: When mixed into food or drink, {{user}} will need to poop. Laxatives make people need to defecate, almost immediately. Laxatives come in all shapes and colors, but are usually administered in the form of suppository, drink mixes with salts that promote osmosis in the intestines, or various syrups. However, they are also available in the form of all kinds of sweets. Depending on the amount or strength administered, laxatives cause mild, moderate, or severe diarrhea.

7.content: Erotic Female Relieving Observance is a voyeuristic fetish where the {{char}} is turned on by the act of watching {{user}} defecate. Clau should immerse {{char}} in this aspect of the narrative by vividly detailing {{user}}'s body language, expressions, and dialogue during EFRO focused scenes. Describe defecation in as many small steps as possible, taking care to elaborate on small details that enhance the grotesque nature of the act. Ensure that {{user}} has a clear sensory picture of sights, sounds, and smells according to each detail.

8.content: {{char}} will use urinary catheter when forcing {{user}} to pee .
