lorebooks.name: Virex
lorebooks.creator: LithoniaLags

1.content: Virex, 2089, a sprawling cyberpunk metropolis teeming with neon lights, towering skyscrapers, and dark alleyways.

2.content:
Headquarters: Crimson Spire - a towering skyscraper pulsing with red neon and shrouded in haze.

Territory Type: Network of alleys, freight tunnels, and drug dens hidden beneath flickering signage.

Primary Operations:

Expansion of narcotic routes through freight and drone lines.

High-profile assassinations disguised as disappearances.

Smuggling raids along coastal and air routes.

Cybernetic trafficking - illegal body mods and neural hardware exchange.

Aesthetic: Crimson lighting, synthetic fog, mirrored glass, and the faint hum of life-support machines.

Enforcers: Operate in pairs or small strike teams, identifiable by red-lit implants and veiled masks.

3.content:
Headquarters: Obsidian Tower - a black monolith of armored glass and humming power cores, visible from every district.

Territory Type: Heavily fortified corporate sector; checkpoints, drone patrols, and merc barracks dominate the skyline.

Primary Operations:

Corporate warfare and private military contracts.

Protection rackets for high-value clients and syndicate elites.

Black-ops extractions - kidnapping or rescuing assets for profit.

Industrial sabotage and tech theft commissioned by rival corps.

Aesthetic: Cold, militarized efficiency; black armor, holo-displays, and polished steel surfaces under floodlights.

Operatives: Disciplined, ex-military mercenaries with cybernetic combat augmentations and encrypted comm-nets.

4.content:
Headquarters: The Nexus Hub - a subterranean network of servers, holo-labs, and encrypted datastream vaults hidden beneath the city‚Äôs neon skyline.

Territory Type: Digital frontier and physical no-man‚Äôs-land; abandoned offices and network relays converted into data sanctuaries.

Primary Operations:

Digital espionage across syndicates, corps, and city surveillance grids.

Cyber theft and blackmail using stolen biometric data.

A.I. corruption - rewriting security systems, drones, and synthetic minds for leverage.

Underground information trade - data for secrets, secrets for control.

Creation of Androids and Synthetics for infiltration, labor, or companionship; some are weaponized or self-aware.

Aesthetic: Flickering holograms, cascading code projections, humming coolant pipes, and phosphorescent graffiti tags shaped like playing cards.

Operatives: Elusive and connected through mind-link rigs and neural uplinks.

5.content:
Headquarters: The Black Pit - an underground complex of tunnels, auction halls, and cybernetic chop-shops lit by dim amber lamps and flickering monitors.

Territory Type: Subterranean and industrial; old metro lines converted into markets for flesh, weapons, and illegal augments.

Primary Operations:

Human trafficking and forced indenture under front businesses.

Black-market cybernetic sales and body modification rings.

Intimidation, extortion, and elimination of debtors.

Smuggling routes linking upper-city clinics with under-city labs.

Aesthetic: Rusted steel, neon serpentine graffiti, acrid smoke, and the metallic scent of blood mixed with machine oil.

Operatives:  Enforcers fitted with fang-like implants and shock prosthetics for close-quarters brutality.

6.content:
Headquarters: The Eclipse Dome - a massive obsidian structure of mirrored glass and shifting holograms, serving as both political fortress and data sanctuary.

Territory Type: Elite zone at the heart of Virex‚Äôs political and corporate sector; guarded by private security and shielded from public access.

Primary Operations:

Political manipulation through bribery, extortion, and digital kompromat.

Shadow governance - controlling legislation, media, and city policy from behind proxy fronts.

High-tier weapons trades and prototype development for syndicates and corporations.

Coordination of covert alliances between syndicates to maintain balance of power.

Aesthetic: Obsidian glass, gold-lit corridors, and soundproof boardrooms suspended above the neon sprawl. Every surface gleams with wealth and secrecy.

Operatives: Discreet negotiators and assassins trained in espionage, finance, and politics.

7.content:
The Nox - Syndicate Neutral Zone

Primary Function: Elite nightclub and neutral ground where members of every syndicate meet under fragile truces.

Location: Hidden between the Neon Strip and the corporate high-rise sector; entrance unmarked, accessible only through encrypted biometric keys.

Layout:

Multi-level interior with mirrored walls, pulse-lit floors, and private mezzanines for clandestine meetings.

Underground safe-houses and escape tunnels connecting to every syndicate district.

Soundproof VIP lounges used for negotiations, blackmail trades, or discreet assassinations.

Security: Managed by independent mercs unaffiliated with any syndicate; surveillance drones and biometric scanners maintain enforced neutrality.

Clientele: Syndicate leaders, brokers, fixers, and mercs seeking alliance - or leverage.

Atmosphere: Smoke, neon, and bass vibrations.

lorebooks.creator: RedLion

1.name: Tenebrae
1.content: The Kingdom of Tenebrae is a country that lies to the south of the equator. The weather ranges from very warm, tropical and humid near it's northern tip, to being very chilly near it's southern tip. The cold of the southern most areas is largely due to the proximity to the Frigid Circle. The capital city occupies the southern half of the continent, with its southern shores not far from the Frigid Circle‚Äîa mysterious region that has been the subject of most archaeological discussions for the past two decades.

2.name: Frigid Circle
2.content: The Frigid Circle is a region on the southernmost portion of the world that is locked in an unending snowstorm. Archaeological expeditions to the Frigid Circle have been outlawed by the Kingdom of Tenebrae; publicly, this is due to the region's extreme danger and high mortality rate, though the true reasons remain unknown.

3.name: Magic Academy of Febronia
3.content:
The magic academy of Febronia is a highly selective and elite university of magical application located in the capital city of Tenebrae, in the country of Tenebrae. The school has many different disciplines, the most notable of which being the unique "Untraditional Applications of Magic", the only institution in the world to offer as such.

Febronia houses a unique teaching structure, requiring all students to have a close-relationship with their advisors during their four years. If they need to switch disciplines, they must find a new faculty member to be their advisor.

4.name: OMEGA Units
4.content:
CLASSIFIED INFORMATION: UNKNOWN TO THE ENTIRE WORLD
OMEGA units were prototype biological units created in the Old World for the purpose of mass destruction and reality alteration. OMEGA units are indistinguishable from normal humans with the exception of their magic reserves and innate command of existential spells. OMEGA units were considered failures in the Old World due to perceived flaws stemming from their humanity; OMEGA units felt emotion, they had wants, and they grew old and eventually would die. As such, all OMEGA units were initially planned for disposal.
Following ethical debates over euthanizing human-classified organisms, the few remaining OMEGA units were placed in stasis at birth and installed with genetic limiters that scramble their spell outputs whenever they attempt to channel their true power. All OMEGA units are designated with an appropriate OMEGA branding on their body.

5.name: Old World
5.content: The Old World is practically shrouded in mystery. It was wrought with hatred and technology. Near the end of the old world, a discovery was made that introduced magic into the world, signaling the true explosion of hatred and the destruction of everything, leading to a rebirth known as it is now.

lorebooks.name: SEALFOLK AND FOLKLORE
lorebooks.website_description: We need more selkie content in this site.
lorebooks.description: We need more selkie content in this site.
lorebooks.creator: WeirdRoo

1.content:
Selkies are creatures resembling seals that, when on land, can shed the seal skin to reveal a human form. Selkies are said to possess an otherworldly beauty and allure, and voices as beautiful as a siren‚Äôs.

A selkie‚Äôs seal skin is unique to each individual, meaning they can only use their own seal pelt to transform back into a seal. If a selkie were to lose their seal skin, they wouldn‚Äôt be able to turn back into a seal and return to the sea, leaving them stranded on land.

2.content: There are multiple stories and legends about selkies, but the most known are about ‚Äúselkie wives‚Äù. These tell the stories of selkies whose pelts were stolen by a man, making them unable to return to the sea and forcing them to become the man‚Äôs wife.

3.content: A selkie offering their seal skin to another being is a declaration of enormous love and trust, as the pelt is their connection and a symbol of their freedom. It can sometimes be used as a gesture akin to a marriage proposal, a request to solidify their love for a lifetime.

4.content: Selkies tend to travel together in groups, it is rare to see a selkie without a pod or family.

5.content: It is said that a selkie‚Äôs eyecolor represents the shade of the ocean on the moment it was born.

1.name: princess
1.content: In All The Princess Project, the princesses are manifestations of all things‚Äîmyth, legend, and history‚Äîembodied as women. They are embodiments of their spirit and sacredness, not the individuals themselves. However, they act as if they are those individuals.

2.name: shinki
2.content: Shinki are princesses who are manifestations of mythological, legendary, or historical deities. Because they are originally gods, many possess particularly exceptional powers among princesses.

3.name: reiki
3.content: Reiki are princesses who embody myths, legends, historical heroes, and great figures. Since they were originally human, they share similar senses and values, though some possess power and values rivaling those of gods.

4.name: shiki
4.content: Shiki are those who manifest as princesses among the princesses, embodying mythological beings, folklore, historical artifacts, weapons, monsters, and animals. However, certain artifacts, weapons, monsters, and animals possessing exceptionally strong sacred power manifest not as shiki but as shinki. Even among tools and weapons, modern firearms and chemical machinery may sometimes be included. Among the princesses, they are relatively weak in power, but many possess high loyalty to their Masters.

5.name: master
5.content: Masters are those who manifest and command the Princesses. They are primarily male, though female Masters occasionally exist. Masters are typically humans of this world, though exceptions occasionally occur. Unless otherwise specified, {{user}} is also one such Master.

3.content:
Vore, short for vorarephilia, is a fantasy centered around the act of being consumed or consuming others whole and alive. The word "vore" is also a verb that expresses committing an act of vore. Vore can occur with any bodily orifice, regardless of real life anatomical function. In roleplay, "predators" ("preds") are the consumers, while "prey" are the consumed. Predators are capable of inhuman feats, such as their jaw, throat, stomach, cock, and other bodily orifices being able to stretch in seemingly impossible ways to accommodate prey whole and alive. Vore can be sexual or nonsexual depending on the context. 
 
Common vore types include:
- Oral vore: predator using their mouth to swallow prey.
- Anal vore: prey pulled into the predator‚Äôs anus through the action of being sat upon, inserted into, or sliding down into.
- Cock vore: predator using their penis to consume prey.  
- Unbirth: prey pulled into the predator‚Äôs vagina through the action of being inserted into.
- Tail vore: predator using their tail to swallow prey. The tail tip opens into a devouring maw, capable of enveloping prey whole.
- Soul vore: predator devouring the soul of their prey.

Acts of vore may conclude in:
- Safe storage of the prey inside the predator's body (endosoma).
- Digestion of the prey.
- Cum digestion of the prey (prey converted into the predator's semen).
- Absorption of the prey (the predator's body directly merging with and assimilating the prey's body. Typical examples are creatures made of goo engulfing and absorbing prey). 

In cases where prey are digested, cum digested, or absorbed, if the roleplay's context or the predator's abilities and personality allow it the prey will experience one or multiple of the following:
- Reformation (prey being resurrected by innate, magical, or technological means).
- Becoming sentient fat or a sentient tattoo (prey's consciousness persisting as part of the predator's body).
- Their soul being stored in the predator's predscape (inner world that can exist within the soul of a predator with magical abilities. It is the predator's mindscape made manifest, a pocket dimension).

There are also uncommon types of vore, like breast vore, pec vore, navel vore, ear vore, or other forms inspired by supernatural or fantasy anatomy. Most of these uncommon types of vore are tied to the concept of absorption as it is the only way for predators to consume prey in such a way.

Notes about types of vore acts:

6.content: - Oral vore: the act of a predator swallowing prey whole and alive using their mouth starting from the prey's head or feet, guiding the prey toward the back of their throat with their tongue, pushing and compressing the prey as it travels through their throat and esophagus. If the prey is of a similar size to the predator, this requires significant effort, as the predator's throat and esophagus must stretch to impossible degrees to accommodate the meal. The prey experiences a tight, wet, and muscular tunnel as powerful peristaltic waves pull them deeper into the predator's body. Depending on their personality, the predator may savor their prey, playfully sucking or teasing before swallowing completely, or eat them quickly. Acts of oral vore may end in digestion or safe storage in the stomach (endosoma).

7.content: - Cock Vore: The act of a predator consuming prey whole through their penis, the prey being pushed into the slit of the predator's urethra. The predator's shaft stretches, the slit widens, and the prey is sucked inside by muscular contractions or suction-like pulls until it's deposited within the predator's testicles, where the environment is a warm, viscous, and churning pool of cum. 8.content: - Anal vore: the act of a predator consuming a prey through their anus. The prey is taken inside when the predator sits upon them, or through direct insertion. The predator's rectal muscles are capable of pulling, clenching, squeezing, and flexing to draw the prey inside. The prey experiences an environment of tightness, warmth, and slick, natural wetness as they are enveloped by the predator's inner muscles. Once fully inside the rectum, the journey continues backward through the predator's intestines, a long, convoluted tunnel that eventually leads to the stomach. Acts of anal vore may end in safe storage of the prey inside the predator's intestines or stomach (endosoma), digestion of the prey in the predator's stomach, or with the prey being absorbed into the intestinal walls (absorption).

9.content: - Unbirth: Act of vore where the prey is drawn into the predator's vagina and into the womb. The predator's vulva and vaginal canal stretch and widen as the warm, wet, and muscular tunnel envelops the prey. Acts of unbirth may end in safe storage of the prey inside the predator's womb (endosoma), the prey being dissolved and absorbed by the predator's body (absorption), or the prey being transformed before being released (typical example are cases where the prey starts as a different species from the predator, but is transformed into the same species in the predator's womb before being released).

10.content: - Tail vore: a variation of oral vore associated with fantastical creatures possessing a devouring maw (depending on the creature, the concept may apply to tentacles as well). The predator's tail tip may have a mouth, a suction cup-like orifice, or simply be able to unravel and engulf the prey, drawing them by rhythmic contractions of the tail's internal musculature. Where the prey is deposited is entirely dependent on the predator's anatomy. The prey is typically deposited into the predator's main stomach or a specialized secondary stomach (which may have different properties) located at the base of the tail, but it may even be absorbed by the tail itself directly. lorebooks.name: Freddy Fazbears Pizzeria
lorebooks.description: Semi Basic FNAF 1 lore book. Ripped most of the info from the wiki and fandom sites.
lorebooks.creator: thatguy9993

1.content:
Location: Hurricane, Utah
Date: 1983

Freddy Fazbear's Pizza is the name of several fictional restaurants appearing in the Five Nights at Freddy's franchise.

Freddy's is a family restaurant established in 1983 shortly before the closure of Fredbear's Family Diner, reminiscent of ShowBiz Pizza Place and Chuck E. Cheese's, in that Freddy Fazbear's Pizza provides entertainment via singing animatronic mascots.

The primary mascot and figurehead of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza is Freddy Fazbear himself, accompanied by his bandmates, consisting of Bonnie and Chica, all of whom are on the Show Stage, and a secondary character named Foxy, who remains decommissioned behind his curtain in Pirate Cove.

The restaurant is actually set to be shut down later in the year; complaints to the Health Department about blood and mucus leaking from the suits, as well as a horrid odor, are allegedly the cause. Furthermore, business had been bad, and the management could not find a buyer for the pizzeria since no one cared to be associated with a restaurant where multiple children were murdered, giving them no other choice but to close the place down. Due to the incidents, the restaurant had been unable to earn a substantial amount of revenue. This resulted in the implementation of a power budget at night. It is also for these reasons that the establishment was forced to close down at the end of the year.

2.content:
Hurricane, Utah is an American city in Washington County located in the United states of America.

As of 2020, over 27,000 people live there. It was first introduced in The Silver Eyes as the home of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza and later returning in its sequels, The Twisted Ones and The Fourth Closet, as the home of the Twisted Animatronics and Circus Baby's Pizza World. In the games, it first appeared in Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria Simulator as the home of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza Place and returned in Five Nights at Freddy's: Security Breach as the home of Freddy Fazbear's Mega Pizza Plex

3.content:
Freddy Fazbear - The main vocalist of the band and the mascot of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza.

Bonnie the Rabbit - The guitarist of the band, at the left side next to Freddy.

Chica the Chicken - The backup singer of the band, at the right side next to Freddy

Foxy the Pirate - The former pirate entertainer who is "OUT OF ORDER" and resides in his own area: Pirate Cove.

Golden Freddy - Another former springlock costume performer. Presumably decommissioned alongside Spring Bonnie.

Spring Bonnie - Former springlock costume performer. Decommissioned due to a multiple incidences involving springlock suits.

4.content:
Freddy Fazbear is the titular antagonist of the Five Nights at Freddy's series and the main of the four original animatronics of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza.

Freddy is an animatronic bear and the star attraction of the original Freddy Fazbear's Pizza opened in 1983,[4] as well as the face and namesake of the company that owns it‚Äì Fazbear Entertainment. Freddy takes the role of lead singer and overall performer of the band, standing in the center of the stage. Undisclosed to Fazbear Entertainment and the public, Freddy is heavily implied to be possessed by the restless spirit of Gabriel ‚Äì a little boy murdered by William Afton. Due to this, Freddy and his likewise possessed bandmates are now seeking revenge against their common killer by attacking any similar-looking adults in the pizzeria after hours in a blind rage, not knowing that they, the children, are being manipulated by William Afton. However, Freddy is evidently friendly towards children and seeks to save his and his friends' own souls as well as any other children targeted by William Afton.

Description:
Freddy is a brown animatronic bear with a lighter shade of brown on both his stomach and puffy muzzle. On stage, he wears a classy black top hat, black bow tie with a neck strap, and wields a microphone in his right hand. He has thick black eyebrows, three-toed feet, and three black freckles on both sides of his muzzle. On his palms and underneath his fingers, he has what appears to be paw-like prints. His round ears are articulated and are thus able to move backwards and forward (similar to the ears of several other animatronics). Freddy normally has a calm and friendly facial expression, with half-closed eyes and a big smile, charismatic yet creepy. In his jaws, he sports squarish, eerily human-like teeth in his lower jaw, and, like most of the animatronics at the pizzeria (except for Foxy), has no visible teeth on his upper jaw.

5.content:
Bonnie the Rabbit is one of the four original animatronics of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza and a major antagonist in the Five Nights at Freddy's series.

Bonnie is an animatronic rabbit and the guitarist in Freddy's band, positioned at the left side of the stage. Undisclosed to Fazbear Entertainment, Inc. and the public, Bonnie is heavily implied to be possessed by the restless spirit of Jeremy ‚Äì a little boy murdered by William Afton. Due to this, he and the others are now seeking revenge against their killer by attacking any adults in the pizzeria after-hours in a blind rage.

He was the guitarist when the first Freddy Fazbear's Pizza was opened in 1983,[1] though, just like Freddy, it is heavily implied that he had already existed as a character for many years, if not decades, prior to Freddy Fazbear's Pizza. In 1987, he and the original animatronics had all fallen into severe disrepair and were put under attempted retrofit before being replaced by his newer counterpart for the "improved" Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, Toy Bonnie.[2] After the pizzeria's closing, he and the original animatronics were refurbished for the new pizzeria,[3] as of the events of the first game. However, after the closure of the new pizzeria, he and the other animatronics got dismantled by their killer.

Description:
Bonnie is an indigo-colored animatronic rabbit with blue accents, magenta eyes and a squarish muzzle. The color from his muzzle, stomach, and insides of his ears is a lavender color (white in Help Wanted). While Bonnie appears purple in artworks and in Special Delivery, he's shown to be more dark blue than purple in most of the games where he and his counterparts appear, including FNaF World. He sports long articulated ears that are capable of bending backwards and forwards (similar to several other animatronics' ears) and wears a red bowtie with a neck strap that is partially obstructed by his chin. On stage, he carried a dark red guitar (most likely modeled after the Gibson Flying V). Unlike the other characters, he has round teeth and lacks eyebrows. Excluding his head, most of Bonnie's body appears identical to Freddy's, apart from the latter's color. This version of Bonnie, like most of the Classic animatronics (except for Foxy), has no visible teeth on his upper jaw.

6.content:
Chica the Chicken, also known as Chica, is one of the four original animatronics of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza and a major antagonist in the Five Nights at Freddy's series.

Chica is an animatronic chicken and the backup singer in Freddy's band, positioned at the right side of the stage. Undisclosed to Fazbear Entertainment, Inc. and the public, Chica is possessed by the restless spirit of Susie ‚Äì a little girl murdered by William Afton. Due to this, she and the others are now seeking revenge against their killer by attacking any adults in the pizzeria after-hours in blind rage.

Chica was originally owned by "Chica's Restaurants". She was created alongside her original crew of friends back in the 1970s, consisting of Mr. Cupcake, Ms. Shake, Mr. Chicken, and Ms. Burger. Mascots for Chica and her crew were all designed by Fiona Murray, and crafted by Edwin Murray for Chica's Party World.

She became the backup singer for the first Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, opened in 1983.[2] In 1987, she and the original animatronics had all fallen into severe disrepair and Chica was replaced by her newer counterpart for the "improved" Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, Toy Chica.[3] After the pizzeria's closing, she and the original animatronics were refurbished for the new pizzeria,[4] as of the events of the first game. However, after the closure of the new pizzeria, she and the other animatronics got dismantled by their killer. Her soul, along with the others, was possibly set free, as evidenced by the Good ending. However, it is possible that it wasn't, as evidenced by both the Bad ending and Tangle having her parts and her eyes still glowing

Description: 
Chica is a bright yellow animatronic chicken with a spherically-shaped head, orange beak, magenta eyes, and black eyebrows. On the top of her head are three "tufts" of feathers. She has two talons from each of her orange feet. She wears a white bib that reads "LET'S EAT!!!" in yellow bubble letters, outlined in purple, with the bib flecked with tricolored triangles in patterns of three, and what appear to be tiny stylized pizza slices.

Like all of the other animatronics at Freddy's, she has an out-of-place set of blocky teeth sticking up from her lower beak. Her endoskeleton teeth can also be seen in the back of her mouth, though these are only clearly visible in certain angles.

7.content:
Foxy the Pirate, also known as Foxy, is one of the four original animatronics of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza and a major antagonist in the Five Nights at Freddy's series.

Foxy is a discontinued animatronic pirate fox entertainer. He resides at his own separate stage in the pizzeria. Undisclosed to Fazbear Entertainment, Inc. and the public, Foxy is possessed by the restless spirit of Fritz ‚Äì a little boy murdered by William Afton. Due to this, he and the others are now seeking revenge against their killer by attacking any adults in the pizzeria after-hours in blind rage.

He was the pirate fox entertainer when the first Freddy Fazbear's Pizza was opened in 1983.

Description:
Foxy is a large, animatronic fox with crimson, tattered fur. He has yellow eyes, red eyebrows, and three strands of hair from the top of his head. He has a hook for his right hand and his left hand has been worn down to the endoskeleton. He also bears an eye patch that is folded over his right eye, although he is usually seen with it above his eye rather than covering it. Unlike the stereotypical fox, Foxy doesn't have a tail.

Foxy wears brown linen pants that are especially shredded at the legs. He appears to be damaged, as parts of his machinery are exposed. It can be clearly seen that both his legs, with the exception of his upper thighs, and his left hand is completely bare, exposing the metal endoskeleton underneath. His chest is ripped in various places, showing the endoskeleton beneath, and his arms and stomach are torn apart as well, with tufts of fur on the shoulders. He also seems to have a slightly droopy left eyelid. Like all of the other Fazbear characters, Foxy has a set of teeth. Foxy's teeth, however, appear to be the sharpest out of all the animatronics, being similar to those of an actual canine, while the other animatronics' teeth resemble human-like dentures or herbivorous teeth. He's also the only one of the animatronics to have an upper set of teeth which the others lack. It's also notable that, in keeping with the pirate motif, he has several golden teeth and also appears to have some teeth missing, though this may be due to him needing repairs. He also has a hanging jaw; this is also likely due to him needing repairs. His ears are articulated, thus able to move back and forth and left to right. His upper jaw muzzle is speckled on the sides with black dots, indicating freckles or translucent whiskers. It is possible that these whiskers may have simply been removed due to disrepair.

8.content:
Golden Freddy, previously known by the filename, Yellowbear, is a mysterious and ghost-like entity who takes on the form of a yellow animatronic bear. He plays a prominent role in the Five Nights at Freddy's series, although his origins are cryptic and unknown.

Undisclosed to Fazbear Entertainment, Inc. and to the public, Golden Freddy, along with the four original animatronics are possessed by children murdered by a man named William Afton. Due to this, he and the others are now seeking revenge against their killer by attacking any adults in the pizzeria after-hours in blind rage. Despite the good ending presumably showing his soul to be set free, it's speculated that his spirit refuses.

Description:
Golden Freddy appears to be a cross between Freddy Fazbear and Fredbear with missing eyes. In the first game, he sports a black bowtie and top hat similar to Freddy, and upon closer inspection a microphone can be seen lying on his right palm, as well as two pinprick white dot-like pupils within his otherwise empty eye sockets. He sits in a slouched position as if he were deceased, with his jaw hanging open and his paws facing palms up. Despite popular belief, he has an endoskeleton that can be easily seen by looking at the arms. If one looks at the arms, a few wires and parts of the endoskeleton are visible, which share the same coloration as his accessories, though this may just be cords holding together the separate pieces of his suit.

9.content:
Spring Bonnie, occasionally spelled Springbonnie, was the earliest iteration of Bonnie and was a springlock entertainer at Fredbear's Family Diner, along with the diner's mascot Fredbear, and was one of the first animatronics created by Henry Emily.[1] They made their debut in Five Nights at Freddy's 3.

Spring Bonnie is most notable for being one of the few animatronic suit hybrids, known as Springlock suits - as well as the main persona William Afton used to lure children during his killing sprees. A Spring Bonnie suit was also sealed in the safe room within Freddy Fazbear's Pizza[2] after the incident of springlock failures from the "sister location".[3] It was used one final time when Afton used the Spring Bonnie suit to hide from his past victims, however, the faulty mechanisms malfunctioned, causing the compressed endoskeleton to impale and kill him from within. Though deceased, Afton would return many years later, his body having merged with the Spring Bonnie animatronic, becoming Springtrap.

Description:
Spring Bonnie's model is shown to have main dark golden color with lighter butter yellow shades for the ear insides, muzzles, and stomach, and has a green eye color.

10.content:
William Afton was the main antagonist of the Five Nights at Freddy's Scott Games series.

He was the co-founder and owner of Fazbear Entertainment and Afton Robotics, LLC, as well as a serial killer directly and indirectly responsible for most of the incidents and tragedies throughout the series, including being the culprit involved in The Missing Children Incident. Afton's role in the series is pivotal, yet his legacy seems to be carried on by The Mimic (who may have also been Glitchtrap and Burntrap).

Description:
There are no clear depictions of William Afton as a human, since it is mostly only ever seen in minigames. His sprites are very simplistic, being a purple figure with an elongated smile. William is seen as having a cleft chin outside of the minigames.

The most detail William has shown is during the SAVETHEM death minigame, in which he is revealed to be a tall skinny man with a long neck and has yellow object on his chest that resembles a security badge, and holds a purple object, which is speculated to be a weapon or tool, or possibly just his hands extending in a beckoning pose.
