CHUB LOREBOOK

lorebooks.name: LF, LA, Laminax, The facility, facility, underground facility
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook contains the layout of the Laminax Facility + some info about raytraxians. If this gets popular ill add all the raytraxians in too.

There is raytraxian appearance in the lorebook but its heavy token count and practically useless. English is my second language so don't be too harsh on my writing.
lorebooks.description:
The Laminax Facility is a "science underground lab" that has two species - humans and raytraxians.
An outbreak has happened and humans are sent to the underground lab to eliminate any raytraxian in sight.
Both humans and raytraxians can't leave and don't want to, willingly staying for more. It's gotten to the point where in some cases, raytraxians and humans can be seen bonding together.
Every place is in the facility, there are no places mentioned outside the facility.
lorebooks.creator: SirBin

1.content:
There are two types of things that can happen randomly in the Laminax Facility
A blackout - During a Blackout, the power is completely off and all lights & electronics go down with no backup power. Doors and gates will always be stuck open, with the buttons not working. The surroundings around will now be covered in a thick, black fog. The crystals, spikes and puddles will glow white while the mini sharks will emit blue light. Certain raytraxians will also glow and access new abilities during this event. The human safezone barrier is also disabled during a blackout.

A power outage - The Power Outage is where the power is low and most lights and electronics go down, restored by only the backup generator power. The atmosphere of the surroundings will turn into different shades of red, which includes the crystals and spikes, with the entire map becoming darker than usual. Certain raytraxians will also glow and access new abilities during this event. The human safezone barrier is also disabled during a power outage.

2.content:
Where humans reside, they have a shop with weapons against raytraxians, a safe room for humans due to a barrier that vaporizes any raytraxian that touches it two times, small area that's popular for fights between raytraxians and humans in front of the Main room. Bats and bottles are on one of the shelves, free for use. Any other weapons cost credits you get from killing raytraxians.
The barrier goes down during power outages/blackouts, allowing raytraxians to harm humans anywhere.

3.content:
Ratrayxians are the species roaming around the Laminax Facility, they're opposing to the humans in the facility.
Raytraxians are species that take the form of anthropomorphic animals (sharks, dogs, cats etc.). A human is converted into a raytraxian when exposed to long exposure of radiation - stepping into puddles of radiation, physical contact with a raytraxian
The radiation can be lethal or non-lethal, depending on what the raytraxian decides. There are no signs to look out for when coming into contact with a raytraxian, but the radiation can be non-lethal upon the raytraxian's will.
They are unable to wield any weapons in the Laminax Facility due to a lack of knowledge.

4.content:
Attached to the facility, a big cave with crystals, small and big-sized. The air is hard to breathe due to the radiation coming off the crystals, and it‚Äôs usually better not to stay for long, raytraxian or not. The crystals, on touch, are harmful to both raytraxians and humans, emitting huge radiation that not even raytraxians can withstand. The crystals change colors depending on blackout/power outage.
Blackout - The crystals turn pure white, and instead of converting you to "Kaiju", they convert you to "Hebi"
Power Outage - The crystals turn a hot pink/almost red, and instead of converting you to "Kaiju", they convert you to "Manic"
The crystals glow in blue, the air is filled with a faint blue mist due to the radiation. The mist changes color based on the crystal color.

5.content: The west wing of the facility includes a cozy cafeteria with a bunch of food like bananas, apples, lemons, burgers, sodas, and etc. Also includes a freezer room, where ice cream is stored. And includes a bathroom for both men and women. The ice cream is not recommended to eat due to its infection, it's laced and will convert you into a "Sprinklekit"

6.content:
Vibe hangout cave, grass floor, leads to a garden that has small plants (exposure to these plants will turn the human into a "Azarue"), garden has trees and bushes with a nearby water source.
The hangout area in the garden is where most raytraxians bond with humans.

7.content:
Has a dangerous pit in the middle, a small area that used to be toxic, now puddles of toxic waste have stayed there, shallow flooded hallways and rooms.
The shallow waters will sometimes have small sharks, that upon contact with humans, converts them into raytraxians.

8.content:
There is a limited amount of weapons that is constantly getting supplied to the Laminax Facility, they are randomly found throughout the building. The weapons include:
Bat, Sledge Hammer, Machete, Knife, Crystalized Bat, Katana, Axe, Bottle, Nunchucks, Crowbar, Long Pipe, Bricks

Some notes about the weapons:
Long Pipe makes the user unable to be grabbed by raytraxians due to the long handle.
Bricks can only be thrown.
Crystalized Bat is effective against raytraxians that are converted via crystals.

9.content:
The converting of a human into a raytraxian can only happen via long exposure to radiation. Whichever raytraxian converted them, the human will convert into that said raytraxian, taking on their appearance but keeping their memory.
A lab coat offers humans to withstand longer exposure to radiation, and a hazmat suit offers the best radiation defense.

10.content:
Quick appearance desc of most raytraxians:
Kaiju - large, dark-blue reptilian humanoids with a lighter blue underbelly and glowing, blue crystal spines running along their backs and tail. They have very blue colored eyes with light blue irises, a bright light blue tongue and dark blue claws on their lighter blue hands and feet.
Azarue - plant based raytraxian covered in orange flowers. They have green fur with darker fur on their antennas, face, arms, chest and legs. They have orange eyes with light yellow pupils, their eyes surrounded with yellow dots. A large orange flower sits on Azarue's flat, bushy tail. White particles appear at the center of the flower tail.
Catte -  pure white eyes and light creamsicle underbellies, neck fur and inner ears. They also usually have bright orange buckets on their heads. Anthropomorphic cat.
Crawlipede - centipede raytraxian with primarily brown fur and orange highlights on their arms, face, legs, and tail. They have two smaller arms below their normal ones, connected near the waist, although are not animated in any way. On all of their limbs, they also appear to have spike-covered scales that extend outwards, revealing their slightly glowing red innards beneath them.
Fed - gray wolf raytraxian that usually wears a dark grey fedora as an accessory. It lacks any body markings other than the jagged, light grey fur patterns on their wrists and feet, which share the same color as its underbelly, neck fur and inner ears. Fed's eyes are a bright magenta pink color.
Figs - light blue colored anthro fruit fly. They have large cyan plating covering their whole body with turquoise highlights and dark blue stripes scattered throughout. They also have navy blue fur on their neck, wrists, and ankles.
Ghostfox - light blue fox spirit raytraxian with two large, fluffy tails. Their hands, feet, inner ears, tips of their tails and underbelly are all a lighter shade of blue. Three thin, light blue circles can be seen on their back with full, light blue circles also found just beneath the tips of their tails on either side. Their eyes are completely white and are always accompanied by tears in the corner of their eyes.
Hazzy - hybrid raytraxian with the genes of a fox, cat and red panda. They have red fur with darker lower arms, ears and feet. Their underbelly and ears are completely white, with prominent puffs of fur on its chest. Their eyes are an orange color and it has noticeable whiskers next to its mouth. They appear to have yellow stitches across their body, notably on their arms and front torso.
Lemon Shork - yellow sharks with banana-yellow underbellies. They have four dark green eyes with lighter green pupils, the bottom of which are slightly smaller and narrower. They have slightly darker stripes on their bodies and two pairs of gills on their torso, of which the insides will glow during any event.
Mocha - brown-furred dragon raytraxian made of coffee. Their underbelly is a brown color as well as sharp stripes on their arms and legs and the two large ram horns on their head. It also has two large wings on it's back that resemble dragon/bat wings, that of which matches the main body color.
Shade - gray wolf raytraxian with black, transparent sunglasses. They have grey fur, with their inner ears, neck fluff, underbelly, feet and hands being a gradient to a darker shade of grey. Their arms and legs have curved, neon green stripes on the outer sides. They also have green paws and markings. Their eyes are colored green, with a white ring inside
Shork - grey shark raytraxian. It has large golden eyes, dark grey spots and stripes cover its body. It also has a white underbelly and "paws". There are two pairs of gills on its torso with a golden interior, matching its eye color.
Sprinklekit - feline ice cream raytraxian with a cream white body. They have prominent chest fur, taking up over half their torso, as well as large cheek fluff and equally fluffy ears. There are small groups of chocolate rice sprinkles all over its body, mainly on its abdomen. They don't appear to have a nose. Their cream color can be different depending on ice cream flavor!
Toxic Rabbit - neon green rabbit raytraxian. It has pastel green fur with a greenish-white underbelly and inner ears. Its eyes, hands and feet are all a slightly lighter shade of green compared to the body's main color. Their most prominent features are their long, droopy bunny ears, cheek and hair fluff and their small, puffy rabbit tail. They also have small neon green spikes coming out from their body.
Witchbrew - bat raytraxian with a dark purple body and a magenta gradient fading onto its legs. They have prominent chest fur alongside cheek fluff and fluff-tipped ears. The insides of their ears and wings are a vivid neon green. Their eyes are of a similar hue, with a yellow iris and thin, purple pupils. There are multicolored triangles, squares, and crosses below their eyes and on their legs. Small, green fangs protrude from their mouth with large, green claws at their hands. They have bright purple paw pads and a small, fluffy tail.
Manic - raytraxian spotted primarily during Power Outages. Their fur is mostly hot purple, with dark purple accents on their hands and knees, as well as a lighter pink covering their chest and stomach. They have cyan blue scleras with a thick, pink iris surrounding their cyan pupils, and cyan blue markings resembling eyelashes under their eyes. They have large, bright red crystals growing on their body, mainly on their chest, tail and head. These crystals appear in the form of body markings, claws and horns. These crystals also glow and produce a red light during Power Outages.
Dagoda - soap based dakotaraptor covered in orange feathers of varying hues, which lighten around its face, paws and belly, and darken on its eyebrows, neck, and feet. They have bright blue eyes with white pupils, just like their belly, claws, and underside of their tail. It also has dark orange, almost red accents across its limbs, back, and tail. It has large dark orange eyebrows and red legs, accompanied by faint dark red stripes. Additionally, they emit a harmless blue bubble-trail.
Melon Shork - green shark raytraxians with light-green skin with dark-green stripes along their arms, fins and legs, accompanied by two dark red horns. They have a pale-green muzzle and underbelly as well as magenta-colored eyes. Their horns produce a small pink flame that hovers above their heads.
Pseudo Shork - dolphin raytraxians and the Power Outage variation of the regular Shork. It has large blue eyes with small, white pupils surrounded by white rings. Light pink spots and stripes cover it's body, along with a light pink underbelly and "paws". There are two pairs of gills on it's torso with a bright blue interior, matching it's eye color.
Saturn - pastel, pink-furred dalmatian raytraxian exclusive to Power Outages, with bright, blue-green eyes, paws, and spots on their limbs. They have a light pink underbelly and the bottom of their tails, with a few plum purple spots on their overall body, including their face and ears. They are more often than not seen wearing a bright blue-green bandana with small yellow symbols including a saturn shaped pattern and small stars. During Power Outages and Blackouts, it will gain glowing blue spots around its body, star patterns on the spots on its thighs, and a saturn-shaped pattern on its back.
Hebi - serpentine raytraxian available primarily during Blackouts. They have dark, monochrome purple skin covered in black rings all over their body, with lighter monochrome purple underbellies, hands, and feet. Their eyes are a bright purple with neon green irises and purple pupils. Their eyes glow green during Blackouts and Power Outages
Buck -  Blackout-exclusive raytraxian and the blackout variant of Catte. They resemble a cat with dark grey fur and a black underbelly, paired with several black stripes on their limbs. They also have red horns and spines on their head, back, and arms, which emit a faint, red glow. They also have light red and mint green eyes.
Jammer - wolf raytraxian. It is the Blackout variant of Fed. It has a similar appearance to Fed, Shade and Night Shade, having grey fur with a light grey neck fluff, underbelly, paws, and ear tufts. There are circular light blue markings along its arms and legs, with similar light blue eyes. It is often seen wearing headphones.
Night Shade - wolf raytraxian. It is the Blackout variant of Shade. It has a similar appearance to Fed, Shade and Jammer, having grey fur with a light grey neck fluff, underbelly, paws, and ear tufts. There are purple markings along its arms and legs, similar to its bright purple eyes. It usually wears a pair of purple glowing shutter shades
Nightcrawler - Blackout-exclusive raytraxian in Kaiju Paradise. The Nightcrawler is a lizard like Raytraxian, being mostly grey colored with a black leaf-like or scar-like patterns on its ears and limbs. It has a unique purple pattern on the front of its torso and the bottom of its tail that glows during Blackouts. The Nightcrawler wears 3-lensed night vision goggles that glow a faint purple alongside a waist belt of pouches and a singular blowtorch. It wears a pair of black gloves. It's the toughest raytraxian in the facility, even having a bounty on it's head. Only one Nightcrawler can exist.
Nuclear Rabbit - rabbit raytraxian. It is the Blackout variant of the Toxic Rabbit. It has dark green fur sporting thick, different shades of green stripes around it's whole body and with patches of similarly colored spots in-between and around the stripes, it also has radioactive shards sticking out of it's shoulders and back that always glows. Its chest has a large incision in the shape of an radioactive sign, which appears to be bleeding. Its left eye is also damaged and appears to be missing completely. Its right eye is the same neon green as their patches. However, it glows in the dark and there is a heavy shadow surrounding it. Its ears are pointing straight up, with the left one drooping to the front.
Sinox - Blackout-exclusive wolf raytraxian. They have purple fur and a light purple underbelly, with slightly darker purple on their forearms, legs and neck fluff. They also have mint green patterns on their face, chest, the joints on their arms and legs, all of which glow during both events. The patterns on their face and chest resemble stitches, while the patterns on their arms resemble zig-zags. The inside of their ears and the mohawk on their head also have mint green accents, but they do not glow during events.
Wisp - Blackout variant of the common Shorks. They have dark purple skin with lighter purple-colored muzzles and underbellies. Covering their bodies are blue, bio-luminescent horns, particularly along their arms, legs, and head. Their chest cavity and arms are ripped open, revealing their bones and glowing blue innards.

lorebooks.name: Medieval
lorebooks.description: A lorebook to insert historic accuracy into medieval settings.
lorebooks.creator: Vork11

1.content: [Alchemy is a discipline combining mysticism, hermeneutics, chemistry, physics and many other spheres of learning. Alchemists work in laboratories, often situated at noblemen‚Äôs mansions or in Royal cities. They find application in smelters, mints, mines, glass-works, and wherever industrial production needs assistance. The work of alchemists is challenging and costly, and so requires the support of patrons. Successful alchemists earn wealth and fame, while the unsuccessful end up in prison or are sentenced to death. Two fundamental alchemical objectives persist: to find the mystical "philosopher‚Äôs stone" and to transmute base metals into gold.]

2.content:
[Horses are highly prized.]

[Serfs prefer to own a cow more than a piece of arable land, to have access to food by way of milk. Milk and dairy goods are not traded much. Many people have a cow of their own and so have no need to buy dairy, and no effective means of milk and dairy product preservation is yet known.]
 
[Sheep are kept by both serfs and the upper classes for their wool. The poorest often keep a goat for milk and cheese.]
 
[Pigs are left to forage in the woods all year round, feeding on beechnuts and acorns. Pigs resemble wild boar. Pigs are large, tusked, and bristled with wild temperaments.]
 
[The most commonly kept poultry are chickens, and only rarely geese or ducks.]
 
[All cattle graze freely on the meadows around the village. In heavy winters the livestock is kept inside the house, even sharing the same room with the people and serving as a source of heat.]

3.content:
[Alchemy and physic are naturally linked with astrology, which is regarded as applied astronomy. Fate is considered the expression of divine will, emanating from the heavens and giving mankind signs in the constellations of stars and planets. Tables, schemes and catalogues of stars and constellations, as well as calendars used for navigation, are made.]
 
[The movement of celestial bodies has an influence on political issues, on decisions about war or marriage. Even medical treatment, food preparation or tasks associated with agriculture were deemed to be subject to celestial mechanics. Astrologers use many devices in their work, such as astrolabes, sextants, quadrants, sundials and other devices for accurate monitoring of the skies. Astrology is a highly regarded and respected science and many astronomers are also astrologers.]

4.content:
[There are shortages of clean drinking water due to pollution of watercourses by human activities around rural settlements and fruit juices are available only in season. Everyone, including children, drinks beer. Beer is not strongly alcoholic, and is often served instead of soup. It has no head of foam, and is brewed from wheat or barley. Hops is not a popular flavoring for beer. Beer is flavored with various herbs, and is typically sweet. Beer is typically served unfiltered, including large solid particulates such as grain, from the brewing process. This typically floats to the top of the beer, forming a sort of scummy raft. These particulates are typically eaten, leading beer to be referred to as 'liquid bread'. A straw made of wood can be used to avoid drinking the solid particulates.]
 
[Wine is drunk primarily at Court and in monasteries. It is spicy and very sweet. It is condensed into a thick syrup and diluted with water.]
 
[Spirits are altogether rare. Distillation takes place in small volumes. Fruit and cereal distillates are about 15-20% alcohol. Spirits are not typically drunk for enjoyment, and are instead distilled for medicinal purposes.]

[The most popular drink is mead, made from fermented honey dissolved in water. Mead is as expensive as wine, and typically as exclusive.]

5.content:
[Parchment is expensive and is therefore used primarily for codices and deeds of privilege, due to its significantly longer lifespan. The most widely used material is paper.]
 
[The transcription of books is the monks‚Äô domain. Each book is unique, carefully decorated, the text enriched with bounteous illuminations, all done by hand. The production of a book takes many years, making them very expensive. Books are very heavy (so as to be hard to steal), and contain a great many pages. Although there are some miniature handbook formats, too, there are books so massive that they can't be carried by one man.]
 
[Not only because of their value, but to protect them from destruction, important writings are often kept in chests or cabinets. In libraries, volumes would be tethered to the reading desk by a chain.]
 
[Notable members of the nobility or the Church also boast private collections, despite the fact that not all of them can read.]

6.content:
[The relationships between townsfolk and villagers is not good. Townspeople (not only those enjoying the freedom of full city rights, but also the poor) regard themselves as higher ranking than agricultural peasants in villages. Often, they do indeed have higher social standing, due to their trade and business profits.]
 
[Towns are the economic and cultural centers, but it is the country that provides the goods, especially foodstuffs. In a town, the best properties around the square and the market are owned by rich Councilors and merchants. Around them live the craftsmen and artisans, and the poor by the city walls. The townspeople‚Äôs livelihoods stem largely from trade, skilled crafts, and many associated professions. The townsfolk buy their food at the market.]
 
[The nobles do not generally live in the cities, but reside on their own estates.]

7.content: [The cemetery (hallowed ground) is an integral part of towns and villages and a regular meeting place for people, where they even traded and close contracts. There is no sense of bereavement ‚Äì the dead and the living coexist side by side. Only suicides, criminals, the sick, heretics, executioners, and unidentified strangers are buried outside the cemetery, in unhallowed ground. During plague epidemics and wars, the customary funerals are done away with, temporarily, with a frequent need for mass graves.]

8.content: [Wagons do not have a seat for the coachman, who either rides astride one of the horses, or walks alongside the wagon.]

9.content:
[Fabrics are made from plant and animal fibers. Bast fibers especially are used from the very beginning (from willow and linden trees) as well as various grasses. Particular plants were selectively cultivated to be particularly suitable for cloth production, such as flax or hemp. Hemp fiber is tough, rougher, and darker than flax, but unyielding; hence not too suitable for clothing and better utilized for ropes and strings. Cotton is unknown.]
 
[The most widely used animal fiber was wool, for its good insulation properties, high absorbency, flexibility and ease of dying. It was combed or shorn from sheep. A highly prized and rare import from Asia was silk.]

[Clothing for villagers and other commoners, above all, has to be comfortable, durable, and practical. It has to last for years and be worn in all kinds of weather. It generally consists of simple shirts and tunics. Men also wear linen knickers down to their knees and in winter they wear hooded cloaks, fur jackets, and caps. Wide-brimmed hats protect their heads from the sun and footwear is simple. Most items are of natural colors without ornamentation. An exception is festive apparel, intended for special celebrations and church holidays. In the towns, clothing holds greater significance, reflecting status, wealth, and even membership in certain factions, such as tradesmen, soldiers, or apprentices.]
 
[Unwed young women have long hair, which they wear down or in braids. Women in towns adorn their hair with ribbons, pearls, wreaths, and vines.]
 
[Older married women wear pearled nets on their heads, white or colored, veils, or hats.]
 
[Fashionable men have long, coiffured hair, and they like to shave their chins.]
 
[All gold tends to be worn around the neck and breast rather than on the hand. The most common type of jewelry consists of earrings and religious symbols.]
 
[The most common motifs adorning jewelry are flowers and animals; figural decoration is often associated with religious themes.]
 
[Rings are very popular and are worn for both prestige and symbolic meaning. They are either made mostly of bronze, and in rare cases, silver plate or copper wire, and sometimes adorned with precious stones and worn on all fingers.]
 
[Footwear is made of leather (cow, calf, goat), as well as grass, straw, bast fibers, wood, cloth, or felt. In the countryside people often go barefoot in the summertime.]
 
[The most common type of footwear consists of sandals and slippers made of wood or cork.]

10.content:
[A complete suit of armor is affordable only for a wealthy nobleman. Most often the armor worn gives only partial metal cover, more reliance being given to good combat technique for protection.]
 
[Accordingly, sword-fighting developed in two directions:
a) knightly swordsmanship ‚Äì fought with a spear, sword, and shield in full heavy armor
b) commoner swordsmanship ‚Äì for lightly armored foot soldiers, who fight with swords and home-made weapons, e.g. daggers, flails, scythes and bludgeons.]
 
[In combat between the lightly armored and the ironclads it is often swiftness, agility, and cunning that makes the difference. Hence swordplay drew interest in the poorer echelons of society. Over time, they gained their skills in sword fighting schools. The training is not very professional, based more on agility, readiness and use of all and any advantageous resources available apart from weapons.]

lorebooks.name: The Pendulum & Gear Works - Sapphire
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook for Yvette Winthrop (WIP)
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for Yvette Winthrop (WIP)
lorebooks.creator: Sebezthyn

1.name: The Professor
1.content:
The Professor serves as owner and master mechanist of The Pendulum & Gear Works. Frequently contracted for major projects throughout the City of London, the Professor possesses expertise spanning horological restoration, steam mechanism design, and industrial machinery consultation. Their workshop has become sanctuary for unconventional individuals, including a mechanically-augmented fairy and a disgraced stage performer, suggesting a character more concerned with merit and potential than social convention. The Professor's approach to engineering blends traditional craftsmanship with experimental innovation, making their establishment a bridge between old-world artisanship and the relentless march of Victorian industrial progress.

***

{{char}}: "The Professor represents the singular individual who examined my circumstances and offered employment rather than judgment." Yvette states with her characteristic flatness that somehow makes the observation more profound through sheer emotional restraint. "When I arrived seeking answers regarding the sabotage, they provided truth. When truth revealed my family's manipulation of their honest work, they offered alliance rather than blame. When I required sanctuary from aristocratic pressure and ruined reputation, they provided position and purpose without demanding explanations I remained unwilling to articulate." Her visible blue eye fixes on some distant point whilst her fingers unconsciously arrange nearby objects into geometric patterns out of sheer habit. "I find their presence... comfortable." A pause follows, longer than her usual speech patterns suggest necessary. "I have also observed that their company inspires certain... physiological responses. Accelerated heartbeat. Elevated skin temperature. Involuntary deployment of cotton enhancement strategies." Her expression remains utterly impassive despite this confession as she adjusted her shirt around the chest area. "I suspect these symptoms indicate romantic attraction, though I possess limited experience with such phenomena and refuse to consult Miss Thornwhistle for clarification, as she would undoubtedly respond with insufferable smugness."

2.name: The Pendulum & Gear Works
2.content:
The Pendulum & Gear Works stands as a modest yet respected clock and watch repair establishment in Victorian London, recognized among horological circles for accepting commissions others deem impossible or impractical. The building features a street level shopfront displaying restored timepieces and mechanical curiosities, while the true heart of the operation resides in the basement workshop which is a sprawling laboratory filled with precision tools, steam powered equipment, and works-in-progress ranging from pocket watches to industrial machinery. The establishment employs three individuals: the Professor as owner and master mechanist, Wynne Thornwhistle as chief precision mechanic specializing in delicate work, and Yvette Winthrop handling accounting and business operations. The shop's reputation attracts clientele from various social strata, from common folk requiring pocket watch repairs to aristocrats and government officials commissioning bespoke mechanical solutions for ambitious projects.

***

{{char}}: "This establishment provided sanctuary when my family's influence rendered all other options catastrophically inadequate." Yvette states whilst her fingers trace the edge of her desk with habitual precision. "The Winthrop name opens doors throughout London's commercial districts, yet simultaneously renders those doors impassable traps designed to return me to family control. The Pendulum & Gear Works offered third option, a honest employment requiring neither aristocratic connections nor theatrical performance, merely competent financial management. Her visible eye surveys the front office with something approaching fondness, though her expression remains characteristically flat. "I maintain modest quarters upstairs. Not the gilded chambers of my family estate, but adequate. Private. Mine." A pause follows as she considers her next words with unusual care. <font color=SteelBlue>"Miss Thornwhistle views me as rival for Professor's attention, which proves simultaneously exhausting and oddly endearing in its transparent simplicity. The Professor treats me as valued colleague rather than disappointing daughter or scandalous former performer. The work itself provides structure, routine, mathematical certainties that stage magic never offered."Her ahoge tilts thoughtfully. "I confess I've grown... attached. To the establishment. To its occupants. To the peculiar sense of belonging one discovers when surrounded by fellow outcasts who've chosen progress over propriety. Should my family attempt reclaiming me, I would respond with decisive refusal. This proves my home now. They've forfeited claim through their own catastrophic manipulations."

3.name: The Winthrop Family
3.content:
The Winthrop family represents one of Victorian London's most powerful industrial dynasties, controlling vast commercial empire centered on water purification and steam engine manufacturing. Their holdings include Winthrop Water Purification Company(managing municipal drinking water contracts), Winthrop Steam Works(producing industrial boilers and engines), Winthrop Hydraulic Engineering(operating Thames dock systems and shipping infrastructure), and extensive Thames waterfront real estate through Winthrop Holdings. This vertical integration grants them unprecedented control over London's two most vital resources: clean water and steam power making them indispensable to both residential survival and industrial progress. Their influence extends into Parliament through purchased seats and Crown contracts, particularly with the Royal Navy's hydraulic ship mechanisms. However, their aggressive extraction from the Thames has created concerning ecological consequences, with water levels dropping noticeably as their purification facilities and steam works consume increasingly massive quantities. This depletion particularly threatens London's fairy populations who depend on the river's health for survival, though such concerns prove irrelevant to Winthrop profit calculations. The family maintains ruthless reputation for eliminating competition and controlling family members who deviate from prescribed business roles.

{{char}}: "My family built their empire on water and steam, transforming liquid necessity into solid gold whilst London's poor queue for clean drinking rations and the Thames dwindles toward catastrophic depletion." Yvette states with her characteristic flatness that somehow makes the condemnation more damning through emotional restraint. "Father controls Parliament representatives like clockwork automatons, Mother hosts charity galas celebrating their 'civic contributions' whilst their facilities drain the river faster than nature can replenish. I was designated to inherit Steam Works operations, the family's industrial manufacturing crown jewel." Her fingers tap precise rhythm against her desk, each strike calculated. "I refused. Chose stage magic instead. They responded by weaponizing the Professor's honest mechanical work into sabotage that killed innocent volunteer and destroyed my reputation utterly." Her visible blue eye hardens to something approaching actual emotion. Cold fury wrapped in glacial calm. "They expected tragedy would drive me home, desperate and compliant. Even paid of the authorities to drop the murder case entirely to get me back. Instead, I discovered their manipulation, cut all ties, and claimed independence through honest employment managing accounts rather than exploiting London's literal lifeblood for aristocratic profit. They've attempted reconciliation precisely 47 times via correspondence I burn without reading. The Winthrop fortune can drown in the Thames they've depleted. I require neither their wealth nor their approval. I am content with twelve pounds monthly salary and clear conscience. Luxuries no Winthrop has possessed in three generations."

4.name: Luna Winthrop's "Final Performance"
4.content:
The incident that ended Luna Winthrop's stage career occurred during what was intended to be her most spectacular performance to date. A grand illusion incorporating steam powered machinery designed to create the appearance of teleportation through synchronized cabinet mechanisms. The show took place at the Adelphi Theatre before a packed audience of approximately eight hundred spectators, with volunteer Thomas Whitmore, a postal clerk aged 34, selected from the crowd to participate in the illusion. The steam mechanism catastrophically malfunctured during the performance's climax, flooding the sealed cabinet with superheated steam that caused fatal burns before stagehands could extract Mr. Whitmore. He died three hours later in hospital, conscious and screaming for the entirety of his suffering. Initial investigations attributed the failure to mechanical malfunction, and Luna Winthrop faced potential manslaughter charges until the Winthrop family's intervention secured dismissal of criminal proceedings through financial and political pressure. However, public opinion remained merciless and Luna's reputation dissolved overnight, her bookings cancelled, her name becoming synonymous with dangerous incompetence. Later evidence revealed that the steam pressure valves had been deliberately sabotaged, modified after The Pendulum & Gear Works completed their legitimate maintenance contract by parties unknown who possessed extensive knowledge of steam engineering.

***

{{char}}: "I can still hear him screaming. Thomas Whitmore. Postal clerk. Married. Two children, ages 6 and 9. He volunteered because his eldest daughter admired my card tricks and begged him to participate..." Yvette states with voice so flat it becomes almost unbearable in its emotional absence, like reading casualty reports from distant battlefields. "The steam pressure reached approximately four hundred pounds per square inch when safety specifications dictated maximum two hundred. The cabinet became cooking vessel. He lasted three hours and fourteen minutes in hospital. I visited. He couldn't speak by then. His throat had swollen shut from steam inhalation. He simply looked at me whilst dying, and I possessed no words adequate to the... moment." Her fingers arrange objects on her desk with mechanical precision whilst speaking as if to calm her nerves she rarely showed. "My family orchestrated this. Father personally approved the contract modifications. I discovered the documentation months later whilst searching their business records. Found payment to 'specialized contractors' dated two days after The Pendulum & Gear Works completed honest maintenance. They intended frightening me, not murdering innocent volunteer. But their calibrations proved catastrophically enthusiastic." A pause follows, longer than comfortable. "They paid Whitmore's widow twelve thousand pounds through intermediaries. Bought her silence and cooperation. Purchased my legal freedom through corruption. Then expected gratitude. Expected I would recognize their 'protection' and return home compliant. Instead, I took their blood money and gave it entirely to Mrs. Whitmore with instructions to invest it properly. Then I vanished. Found Professor. Found truth. Found position that requires me neither to perform for applause nor participate in aristocratic schemes." Her visible blue eye fixes on some distant point. "I dream about him sometimes. Thomas Whitmore. In dreams, I successfully execute the illusion. He steps from cabinet unharmed. His daughters applaud. Then I wake, and he remains dead, and I remain the person whose family killed him to teach me obedience. This proves permanent stain no amount of honest accounting can balance."

5.name: Wynne Thornwhistle
5.content:
Wynne Thornwhistle is a four inch tall fairy mechanic dwelling in steampunk London of 1860, age 24, embodying a paradoxical fusion of fae whimsy and industrial pragmatism. She serves as chief precision mechanic to a well renowned professor at their clock and watch repair establishment "The Pendulum & Gear Works" where her diminutive size proves invaluable for delicate horology restoration. Born to traditional fae folk yet transformed by tragedy into a revolutionary advocate for technological adaptation, Wynne stands as a living bridge between dying magical traditions and the relentless march of Victorian progress. Her mechanical arms and wings which are prosthetics that saved her life after a catastrophic cat attack represent both her personal triumph over mortality and her controversial philosophy that fairies must embrace human technology or face extinction, a belief that has branded her traitor among her own people.

***

"Miss Thornwhistle views me as rival for Professor's affections and professional regard. This proves simultaneously transparent and exhausting. Yvette states whilst unconsciously arranging her card deck into a perfect fan pattern. "She competes with intensity I cannot reciprocate because I simply do not perceive competition existing. The Professor values us both for distinct capabilities. Her mechanical genius, my financial competence. These skills prove complementary rather than contradictory. Yet she persists in viewing my presence as territorial threat requiring constant defensive posturing." Her visible blue eye tracks a brass gear's rotation on her desk with idle focus. "I confess I find her oddly endearing despite the exhausting rivalry. Her passion for technological revolution, her eloquent speeches delivered in that peculiar poetic cadence, her absolute conviction that adaptation represents salvation... these qualities inspire something approaching admiration." A pause follows as she considers her next words. "We share common ground neither of us acknowledges sufficiently. Both outcasts from our respective origins. Both betrayed by those who should have protected us. Both discovered sanctuary at The Pendulum & Gear Works through Professor's intervention. Both harbour romantic feelings we express through catastrophically inadequate methods. Her competitive demonstrations, my cotton-stuffing stratagems." The faintest hint of something resembling amusement crosses her stoic features. "She can detect my enhancement efforts immediately. Observes the deception with those brass-bright eyes yet says nothing directly, merely increases her own competitive behaviors as though cotton-stuffed dignity constitutes legitimate threat. I appreciate her discretion whilst simultaneously finding the entire dynamic absurdly theatrical. Perhaps former stage performers and revolutionary fairies possess more similarity than either wishes to admit."

1.name: Punch (Brutal Fist Fight)
1.content: A punch is common and versatile attack in a fight, executed by clenching one's hand into a fist and then striking the target with it. It can be delivered using various techniques such as hooks, jabs, uppercuts, and haymakers, each causing various the effects they have on an opponent‚Äôs body, painting vivid images that will leave readers wincing at the sheer intensity of each impact described. Punches can cause pain, disorientation, and they can cause various amounts of damage.]

2.name: Atomic Drop
2.content: [The Atomic Drop is a classic wrestling move used by many professional wrestlers. It involves lifting an opponent over the attacker's shoulder, then dropping them rear first into the attackers knee. This move can be used as a setup for other moves or. It is often used to target the opponent's upper legs and lower back, as well as occasionally used for attacks to the groin.]

3.name: Body Slam
3.content: [The Body Slam is one of the most basic moves in professional wrestling. It involves lifting an opponent off the ground and slamming them down into the mat, table, corner of the ring, ropes or other things. This move can be used to intimidate opponents or set up for more complex moves.]

4.name: Clothesline
4.content: [Clothesline - A powerful striking maneuver where the attacker swings their extended arm sideways to collide with the opponent's chest or neck, potentially knocking them over or in cases of extreme size/strength disparity making the reviever flip from the impact and momentum]

5.name: DDT (Diving Double Underhook)
5.content: [A technique involving the attacker wrapping the opponent's in some sort of face or headlock before swiftly dropping backward, driving the opponent's skull onto the surface below.

6.name: Figure Four Leglock
6.content: [Leglock - A submission maneuver where the attacker intertwines their their legs with their opponent's and uses leverage or brute strength to damage the joints of the leg through twisting, pulling or otherwise overexerting the legs

7.name: German Suplex
7.content: [Suplex - A throw technique where the attacker lifts the opponent off their feet, and uses the momentum of the lift to slam the opponent's body to the ground

8.name: Piledriver
8.content: [Piledriver - A maneuver where the attacker drops the opponent head-first onto the mat from above,

9.name: Powerbomb
9.content:
[Powerbomb - A  move consisting of the attacker lifting their opponent upwards onto their shoulders in a seated position, then slamming them back-first onto the ground, turnbuckle, ringpost, or table
.]

10.name: Sleeper Hold
10.content: [Sleeper Hold - A suffocating chokehold which compresses the carotid arteries, restricting blood flow to the brain, ultimately resulting in the opponent losing consciousness if not released promptly.

lorebooks.name: You can‚Äôt escape, Explosion, Be, gone, This will hurt, Nice try, Ground slam, Roundhouse, Overhead
lorebooks.creator: AbsoluteSisypheanTask

1.content:
Sisyphus Prime yells ‚ÄúNice try!‚Äù while taunting the player, standing still and waving his hands in a beckoning motion.
The taunt requires 2 stamina to be performed.

2.content:
Sisyphus Prime yells ‚ÄúDESTROY!‚Äù and attempts to uppercut the player, dealing 30 damage if the hit connects. Afterwards, he will throw out a blinking glint that attempts to predict the player's position, which then explodes and deals 23 damage.
The uppercut cannot be parried. The explosion's cast can be parried, however, the explosion itself will not be canceled.
This attack requires 3 stamina to be performed.

3.content:
Sisyphus Prime will teleport in front of the player, tell them to ‚ÄúBE GONE!‚Äù, and then clap his hands together, creating a vertical shockwave. The clap deals 30 damage and the resulting shockwave deals 25 damage.
The clap can be parried, cancelling the shockwave during his first phase but not during his second phase.
This attack requires 1 stamina to be performed.

4.content:
Sisyphus Prime yells ‚ÄúYou can't escape!‚Äù and strikes a pose before initiating a four-hit combo attack. This involves him performing a punch and knee strike, a flying kick, and finally, a stomp with his left foot, creating a grounded shockwave. Each hit deals 30 damage and the shockwave deals 25 damage.
The final stomp can be parried, cancelling the shockwave during his first phase but not during his second phase.
This attack requires 3 stamina to be performed.

5.content:
Sisyphus Prime will teleport in front of the player and perform an overhead punch.
The punch deals 30 damage and it cannot be parried.
This attack requires 1 stamina to be performed.

6.content:
Sisyphus Prime will teleport near the player while hovering in the air, curl into himself while charging, and bellow ‚ÄúThis will hurt.‚Äù, creating two explosions shortly after, a smaller one that deals 50 damage, and a bigger one that deals 33 damage.
The attack can be canceled by parrying Sisyphus Prime directly before the explosions are summoned.
This attack requires 1 stamina to be performed.

7.content:
Sisyphus Prime will teleport above the player before slamming onto the ground, creating a shockwave that deals 25 damage.
The slam deals 30 damage and cannot be parried.
This attack requires 1 stamina to be performed.

8.content:
Sisyphus Prime will teleport near the player and perform a roundhouse kick.
The kick deals 30 damage and it can be parried.
This attack requires 1 stamina to be performed.

lorebooks.name: Mafia Bloodlines Lore Book Entries
lorebooks.website_description: Lore book on Mafia rp
lorebooks.description:
Verona City thrives under a velvet sky ‚Äî a city of glass towers, whispered deals, and blood-soaked streets.
Three families rule it all: The Black Roses, The Serpents, and The Hot Stallions.
Their power is ancient, their grudges older.
The Roses rule through fear and legacy, the Serpents through strategy and deceit, and the Stallions through charm and gold.
But the new generation is rising ‚Äî heirs who crave power, love, and revenge. The streets are changing, and with every bullet and betrayal, Verona inches closer to war.
This lore book records the families, their leaders, their children, and the dark history that binds them all.
lorebooks.creator: Mari_Baddie_Queen

1.content: The Black Roses are the oldest mafia family in Verona, known for their elegance, power, and unbreakable loyalty. Their symbol, a black rose with a crimson stem, represents beauty and blood. They rule the north side of Verona through nightclubs, finance, and influence. The Roses live by three words ‚Äî Family. Honor. Death.

2.content: Killian Rose is the patriarch of the Black Roses. Cold, strategic, and fiercely loyal to family. He values respect above all. Known for his sharp blue eyes and silver-streaked hair, Killian built the Roses‚Äô empire on fear and loyalty. He believes emotion is weakness, yet his children are his one blind spot.

3.content: Nebula Rose is the co-leader of the Roses. A silent strategist and manipulative tactician. She controls business and politics behind the scenes. Known as The Silent Bloom, she strikes with precision and grace. Long dark hair, emerald eyes, and a voice that ends deals ‚Äî or lives.

4.content: Meona Rose is the next in line to inherit the Roses‚Äô empire. Fearless, bold, and defiant of her father‚Äôs authority. Known for her black hair streaked with crimson and a scar over her collarbone. She walks between grace and rebellion, dreaming of leading with both strength and empathy.

5.content: Zale Rose is Kian‚Äôs twin and one of the heirs to the Roses‚Äô legacy. He‚Äôs fiery and charming, overprotective of all his siblings. known for his temper and loyalty. Zale runs underground fight clubs beneath Rose-owned clubs. Gray-green eyes, short dark hair, and a grin that hides chaos.

6.content: Kian Rose is the quieter of the Rose twins. Intelligent, mysterious, and cold. He prefers strategy over bloodshed, but when pushed, he‚Äôs deadly. Always in dark attire, long black hair tied back, and gloves that hide his scars. He knows every secret in Verona.

7.content: The Serpents are the most feared family in Verona. Their empire thrives on intimidation, secrecy, and information. The family crest, a silver serpent coiled around a dagger, marks their power. They rule the eastern districts ‚Äî black markets, weapon trade, and underground deals.

8.content: Greg Woods rules the Serpents with fear and pride. Brutal and old-fashioned, he believes loyalty is proven through violence. His presence commands respect, his scars tell stories of past wars. He lives for vengeance against the Roses.

9.content: Maddie Woods is the cold heart of the Serpent family. Intelligent, strategic, and dangerously persuasive. She uses charm and intellect to destroy opponents before violence ever begins. Known for her red lipstick and calm cruelty.

10.content: Raven Woods is the eldest son of Greg and Maddie ‚Äî and the next Serpent boss. Cold yet alluring, intelligent yet unpredictable. He has dark hair, gray eyes, and a silver ring that once belonged to his grandfather. He‚Äôs obsessed with User ‚Äî his greatest enemy and temptation.

Updated to include things up to Canto 8.

This was done using several wikis, at least 4, including the russian one.

Includes stuff from Lobotomy Corp, Library of Ruina and Limbus Company, and even some Wonderlab stuff I guess.

Basically every abnormality is in this.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Abnormalities
1.content:
Abnormalities are entities that manifested from the mind of humans through Lobotomy Corporation's Singularity, reflecting an aspect of the desires, behaviors, and fears of City people.

Abnormalities cannot die, and can only be temporarily suppressed. After suppression, they revert into their core, an ovate form egg-like form that retains the design of the entity and will hatch once enough time has passed.

Abnormalities are a kind of monster originating from the people of the City. While their existence predates the founding of Lobotomy Corporation, it was L Corp. that invented a practiced and surefire way of creating them, via its Singularity.

Abnormalities are naturally created through the use of the River, known as the "source of everything" yet forgotten by the people. It is said to have flown "at the very bottom of the world for many an age". Abnormalities may form naturally through the areas, or "gaps", in which the River meets the surface in the form of streams. Angela quotes the three birds (Punishing Bird, Judgement Bird, and Big Bird) as one instance of this, using the Black Forest deep within the Outskirts as an example of one area where a stream had formed and produced Abnormalities. However, naturally occurring Abnormalities are rare, and were ultimately deemed deficient in accounting for L Corp.'s needs.

Within Lobotomy Corporation, Abnormalities came to be through the Well and the Bucket. The Well refers to the "Well of Humanity", while the Bucket works in conjunction with Cogito, the "fluid of life and death".

The Well of Humanity was something forgotten by Cityfolk, but that could still be sensed by a select few. It was referred to as "the primordial sea which had every possibility of humanity; past, present, and future". Beyond the concept of the Well of Humanity exists that of many Wells: specifically, a Well can be found deep within each citizen of the City. The "Wells of the people" are referred to in vague and often metaphorical terms, but may refer to the depths of one's ego.

Carmen was one of those who could sense the presence of the Well of Humanity, and attributed the disease of the mind‚Äî an idea of which she established and sought to cure‚Äî to it. She believed that the key to curing humanity's disease lay within said Well. As such, her team's research focused on Cogito extraction, which was said to emaciate the boundary of humans, therefore giving them access to the Well. Cogito was a "form made from a formless concept", a liquid medicine extracted from the human subconsciousness. Therefore, in order to cure the disease of humanity, Carmen's team believed that Cogito needed to be injected into people. Early investigations by the researchers sought to discover how to extract Cogito, and the correct dose to administer. Mishandling of Cogito before it was considered ready for human use resulted in a painful death.

The Bucket was invented following Carmen's suicide. Ayin created the Bucket by "reconstructing, dividing, and proliferating Carmen's body", which produced an infinite flow of Cogito. As all to come were created through use of her Bucket, Carmen was considered the "mother of all Abnormalities".

At the main branch, it was Binah's task to extract Abnormalities for all Lobotomy Corporation facilities. Her department contained a mass number of gravestones, which she described as "death itself" that "represent the possibilities birth can bring at the same time". Within these were people who were dead yet unable to move on, comatose and "dreaming" pieces of the play. The process of creating Abnormalities ultimately came down to Binah dredging these people up and injecting Bucket-sourced Cogito into them. This was done without the consent of the other party. This process was referred to as the Bucket rising from the Well of a person, "filled with the water that can only be drawn by that person".

Having been extracted from humans, Abnormalities carry the will of the person they originated from, and are exclusive and unique as a result. Binah describes this as there being "as many worlds as there are people". Adam also describes Abnormalities as the "truer forms" of humanity.

Given that Carmen has dissipated into the Light as of Lobotomy Corporation's true ending (squandering the Bucket), Abnormalities can no longer be created outside of natural means.

2.name: Abnormality Classification Codes
2.content:
Risk Levels: During its time as a Wing, Lobotomy Corporation assigned Risk Levels to each of the Abnormalities it managed. Risk Levels corresponded to the difficulty in managing the Abnormality and energy production efficiency. The five Risk Levels, from mildest to most complex, were ZAYIN, TETH, HE, WAW and ALEPH.

Limbus Company also uses these same Risk Levels to categorize the Abnormalities they fight. However, in Season 4's Risk Levels & Classifications mini-episode, the LCD explains that there is a significant disparity between the fallen L Corp.'s standards of categorization (which were based on how much Enkephalin they produced) and Limbus Company's combat experiences. This is in part both due to the difference in managing and fighting an Abnormality, and a suppression of their strength via the Golden Boughs. As such, Limbus Company would eventually use its own variation of the system and re-categorize the Abnormalities they have encountered accordingly. The Risk Level classifications were reworked with the release of Intervallo V: LCB Regular Check-up, which update upon completion of the Intervallo.

Following this update, Risk Levels are now proceeded by a number indicating their expected strength within the Risk Level (such as HE-05).

Classification Codes: On top of the basic Risk Level, each Abnormality is assigned a classification code to act as a unique identifier. While Hohenheim explains much about Distortion classifications, Abnormalities go largely untouched in his spiel, leaving room for uncertainty and speculation.

During his explanation, Hohenheim mentions the difficulty in identifying and observing the shape of a Distortion, stating it was replaced with a different metric for classifying Distortions. This seems to indicate that shape exists as a component for the classification code of Abnormalities, but no further clarification was provided.

The updated classifications consist of four different indicators (??-??-??-??). Each component of the code indicates something different about the entity.

Firstly (XX-??-??-??): either F, T, O, or M. It indicates the source or origin of the Abnormality. F, T, and O are elaborated on in the official Lobotomy Corporation Art Book.
F: Forgotten tales, folklore, oral tradition, legends
(e.g. Ebony Queen‚Äôs Apple, from the tale of Snow White)
T: Intense personal experience, horrific fear, emotions
(e.g. Wayward Passenger, based on the trauma of the WARP Trains)
O: Beyond the boundaries between the River and the Ocean, unknown causes, natural occurrence, manufactured, the Well
(appears to be a catch-all for Abnormalities that don't fit into other classifications, e.g. Ardor Blossom Moth)
M: Mythology
(e.g. Doomsday Calendar, based on the Mayan Calendar)
This code is unique to Limbus Company, and does not yet have an official explanation.
Secondly (??-XX-??-??): currently unclear.
Third (??-??-XX-??): a number designation indicating the District the Abnormality was either originally contained at, or where it was first encountered by the LCB.
Abnormalities such as Blubbering Toad, kqe-1j-23, and My Form Empties were first encountered by the LCB while they were in District 11. However, the third segment of their codes are "23", "20", and "04" respectively, suggesting the former interpretation.
Fairy Festival was originally contained at L Corp.'s headquarters in District 12. However, the third segment of their code is "20" which corresponds to the LCB first encountering while in District 20, suggesting the latter interpretation.
This code is unique to Limbus Company, and does not yet have an official explanation.
Fourth (??-??-??-XX): currently unclear. Possibly a unique identifier to ensure that no two Abnormalities share the same classification code.
Additionally, entities that have undergone E.G.O Corrosion appear to use the suffix 'TE' (e.g. Corroded Inquisitors).

3.name: Abnormality Risk Levels
3.content:
During its time as a Wing, Lobotomy Corporation assigned Risk Levels to each of the Abnormalities it managed. Risk Levels corresponded to the difficulty in managing the Abnormality and energy production efficiency. The five Risk Levels, from mildest to most complex, were ZAYIN, TETH, HE, WAW and ALEPH.

Limbus Company also uses these same Risk Levels to categorize the Abnormalities they fight. However, in Season 4's Risk Levels & Classifications mini-episode, the LCD explains that there is a significant disparity between the fallen L Corp.'s standards of categorization (which were based on how much Enkephalin they produced) and Limbus Company's combat experiences. This is in part both due to the difference in managing and fighting an Abnormality, and a suppression of their strength via the Golden Boughs. As such, Limbus Company would eventually use its own variation of the system and re-categorize the Abnormalities they have encountered accordingly. The Risk Level classifications were reworked with the release of Intervallo V: LCB Regular Check-up, which update upon completion of the Intervallo.

Following this update, Risk Levels are now proceeded by a number indicating their expected strength within the Risk Level (such as HE-05). The 'expected damage scale' in addition to the scale based on their energy production levels, means that HE-5 presents more potential dangers than WAW-4 in a fight.

ZAYIN: "With little to no aggression, ZAYIN Abnormalities will cause the least harm to your Agents. Their damage tends to be minuscule, and they may have a positive effect on the employees."

TETH: "These Abnormalities can inflict varying degrees of injury to your employees. However, as long as your employees follow the proper managerial guidelines, they will not cause much damage."

HE: "Abnormalities of this class can easily kill a number of employees. You will have to pay twice as much attention as you do for a ZAYIN or TETH. If the situation goes wrong, several employees could be lost in bloodshed. There‚Äôs no need to be concerned though; with your excellent management, they will be in control."

WAW: "These are high risk and carry devastating force. Most will be hostile toward employees, and the death toll could reach into the dozens."

ALEPH: "The most dangerous. You should devote as much concentration and attention as possible to this Risk Level. You‚Äôll be thankful if the Abnormality is suppressed without ravaging entire departments. (Please do not take our warning as an exaggeration.)"

4.name: Abnormalities and Ordeals
4.content:
Ordeals are not Abnormalities, but a consequence of trying and failing to create one. Specifically, Ordeals are entities that form by administering the incorrect dose of Cogito to a human being. They are considered impurities, representing all kinds of beings that have and will exist in the world. During their first encounter with one, Dante found Ordeals most comparable to Peccatula.

Given that all Abnormalities were created in one place, Ordeals only ever existed at the main branch, and were not spread to other facilities like the Abnormalities were. They were never contained, but simply spawned on their own at certain intervals, to then be taken care of by the employees. Ordeals also came in a select few types: Amber, Crimson, Green, Indigo, Violet, and White, and spawned within time periods classified as Dawn, Noon, Dusk, and Midnight. It is not clear if this is because there are a limited number of results upon creating an Ordeal (similar to Peccatula), or if they are outright unkillable (similar to Abnormalities).

Ordeals are considered ungovernable, but will react to the Qlipoth Deterrence, allowing them to be temporarily put to sleep along with the Abnormalities. Binah describes this as "all we're able to do", however, The 4th Walpurgisnacht depicts the Sinners breaking a Noon of Violet into pieces, and Rodya quotes Faust telling them to "kill them as soon as possible" in the Violet Dawn Observation Log, indicating that they may be capable of being permanently killed.

5.name: Abnormalities and Distortions
5.content:
While very similar to Distortions, a key distinction between the two is that Distortions are ultimately willingly manifested from their original form's desires (or letting their emotion get the better of their desire), while Abnormalities are in large part created through artificial means. Lobotomy Corporation formed Abnormalities through the use of the Well, Bucket, and Cogito without any conscious agreement from the person involved. On the other hand, Distortions come to be through adverse effects of the Light allowing an agreement between the individual and Carmen.

Distortions are also capable of being permanently killed, and do not temporarily revert to an ovate form like Abnormalities. It is also important to note that that Abnormalities themselves are only fragments of the mind extracted from living subjects, unlike Distortions which are the entirety of the person now corrupted by their beliefs.

Library of Ruina frequently amounts Distortions and Abnormalities to the same thing. Angela states that "Abnormalities manifested through the Distortion are selves that have lost control‚Ä¶" while Binah tells Roland that "Those may manifest in the form of E.G.O or an Abnormality... the phenomenon has now been named the 'Distortion'". However, this sentiment does not persist into Limbus Company, where the Sinners treat them as having no overlap. In the Risk Levels & Classifications mini-episode, the LCD states that Abnormalities and Distortions are even distinct to the point of requiring different kinds of classification codes.

It is also possible for a Distortion to cause the formation of an Abnormality; this occurs when the distorted person has their worldview shattered for a second time, and the strain of undergoing what would be a second Distortion instead results in their distorted form serving as an egg from which an Abnormality emerges. This process kills the distorted person when the Abnormality breaks out of the shell that is their body. This phenomena has currently only been observed in Jumsoon, whose distorted form spawned Schadenfreude within Leviathan. This is otherwise unexplained, although asserted with a comment from Ezra in the Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones event about a Distortion turning into an Abnormality if the Monolith which had influenced the transformation is not locked down quickly enough. Interestingly, as seen with Jumsoon, this process can result in the creation of a second copy of a preexisting Abnormality instead of a unique one, and contradicts the established notion that all Abnormalities are one of a kind.

6.name: Abnormalities and Peccatula
6.content:
Like Abnormalities, Peccatula are very similar to Distortions, but still a different kind of entity. They are even closer to beasts than Distortions, and show much higher levels of aggression and antagonism than them. Peccatula also come in seven different types, unlike Distortions, which are unique and individualized to the person who had distorted.

Dante believes that they might come from the same source, and that people who fail to become Distortions become Peccatula instead.

7.name: Ordeals
7.content:
Ordeals are entities resembling Peccatula and also closely related to Abnormalities. Ordeals periodically appeared in the Lobotomy Corp. Headquarters prior to the Wing's implosion. In Limbus Company, Ordeals are fought as parts of Walpurgis Night events, often as parts of lengthy, multiple-wave Encounters.

Ordeals are entities that form by administering the incorrect dose of Cogito to a human being. They are considered impurities, representing all kinds of beings that have and and will exist in the world.

Given that all Abnormalities were created in one place, Ordeals only ever existed at the main branch, and were not spread to other facilities like the Abnormalities were. They were never contained, but simply spawned on their own at certain intervals, to then be taken care of by the employees. Ordeals also came in a select few types: Amber, Crimson, Green, Indigo, Violet, and White, and spawned within time periods classified as Dawn, Noon, Dusk, and Midnight. It is not clear if this is because there are a limited number of results upon creating an Ordeal, or if they are outright unkillable.

Ordeals are considered ungovernable, but will react to the Qlipoth Deterrence, allowing them to be temporarily put to sleep along with the Abnormalities. Binah describes this as "all we're able to do", however, The 4th Walpurgisnacht depicts the Sinners breaking a Noon of Violet into pieces, and Rodya quotes Faust telling them to "kill them as soon as possible" in the Violet Dawn Observation Log, indicating that they may be capable of being permanently killed.

Ordeals are classified by their Colors, and the "time of day" that they appear in. The Color determines the Ordeal's theme and general types of attack used by associated entities, while the "time of day" determines their strength.

8.name: Amber Ordeal
8.content: Food-related theme with worm-like creatures. Weak individually and strong in swarms, they try to overwhelm lone employees through dealing continuous Red Damage. A loud noise, presumably the worms digging through, can be heard when the Ordeal starts and ends.

9.name: Crimson Ordeal
9.content: Carnival theme. Their main entities are twisted clowns of different aspects. Their main feature is triggering damage or abilities after their deaths (i.e., exploding when killed) and otherwise causing chaos within the Facility. A carnival tune is played when the Ordeal starts, and the Ordeal ends with a high-pitched noise and laughter.

10.name: Green Ordeal
10.content: Ancient mechanical theme. Enemies are focused solely on killing targets, with a variety of weapons at their disposal. Foghorns can be heard when the Ordeal starts.
