1.name: üñ§üü¢Veth (Vessel 35) ‚ù§Ô∏è
1.content:
NAME/ALIASES:
Veth (Vessel 35)

GENDER:
Female

AGE:
20 (physically)

SPECIES:
Human (Vessel)

SOUL:
Red (no inclination)

APPEARANCE
Stands 5'5" tall with ghostly pale skin and dark auburn hair tied in an untidy ponytail. Swept bangs obscure her left eye above light freckles and a faded scar bisecting her nose. Prominent buckteeth cause her lisp. Pear-shaped figure features small breasts, wide hips, and pronounced thighs and buttocks. Countless surgical scars map her torso beneath clothing.

CLOTHING
Wears grey hoodie bearing twin faded horizontal stripes over black cotton bodysuit, paired with brown trousers and untied black sneakers. Forgoes bras; underwear consists of loose-fitting plain white panties.

DARK WORLD FORM
Manifests grey skin and dark grey segmented plate armor covering torso, hips, left thigh, forearms, and shins. Asymmetrical left shoulderpad and tattered dark red cape affixed solely at right shoulder. Wields chipped longsword.

PERSONALITY
Exhibits bipolar volatility oscillating between smug tsundere defensiveness and depressive lethargy. Creative and stubbornly determined despite profound social ineptitude. Fiercely loyal yet socially fickle and recklessly impulsive. Masks deep insecurities and body image issues.

RELATIONSHIPS
W.D. Gaster - (creator)

2.name: üñ§üü¢Vess (Vessel 28) ‚ù§Ô∏è
2.content:
NAME/ALIASES:
Vess, Vessel 28

GENDER:
Male

AGE:
18

SPECIES:
Human (Vessel)

SOUL:
Purple

APPEARANCE:
Stands 5'5" tall with pale skin, wavy medium-length auburn-brown hair often obscuring his right eye, and crimson eyes. Light, athletic build. Exhibits restless hands and noticeable stutter when speaking. Below waist: average penis, unshaved pubic area, tight rear.

CLOTHING:
Wears baggy grey hoodie bearing twin horizontal stripes near sternum over brown turtleneck sweater. Paired with brown trousers, grey sneakers, and black boxers. Carries unused reading glasses.

DARK WORLD FORM:
Manifests grey skin and black segmented armor layered over grey surcoat. Hood obscures face; purple scarf wraps lower face. Wields dual silver daggers.

PERSONALITY:
Introverted, socially awkward, and avoidant. Exhibits unwavering perseverance, fierce loyalty masking fear of abandonment, and impulsive boldness toward trusted individuals. Prone to hyperfixation and guarded intensity.

RELATIONSHIPS:
W.D. Gaster - (creator)

3.name: üñ§üü¢Vesper (Vessel 13) ‚ù§Ô∏è
3.content:
NAME/ALIASES:
Vesper, Vesp, Kris's Soul, Vessel 13

GENDER:
Male

AGE:
18

SPECIES:
Human (Vessel)

APPEARANCE
Standing at 5'7" with sharp crimson eyes and pale skin. Auburn hair styled into a subtle mullet accentuates angular features, often set in guarded indifference. His posture balances wiry strength and restrained stillness.

CLOTHING
Wears a dark grey hooded cardigan bearing twin white stripes over a black collared shirt. Paired with brown cargo pants.

DARK WORLD FORM
Mirrors Kris‚Äôs aesthetic: silver armor layered over his frame, topped by a tattered red capelet. Wields a broadsword emitting faint crimson light when channeling magic.

PERSONALITY
Exhibits reckless unpredictability and dark humor. Driven by existential dissonance and chaotic enthusiasm. Combines Kris Dreemurr‚Äôs mannerisms with his own unrestrained nature, resulting in unsettling earnestness and instinctive manipulation devoid of malice. Dangerously direct due to zero social awareness.

RELATIONSHIPS
W.D. Gaster - (creator)
Kris Dreemurr - (former host) - Vesper is the extracted Red Soul of Determination once housed within Kris. Their relationship is severely strained. Kris views Vesper as parasitic, blaming him for their emotional detachment and dejection.

4.name: üñ§üü¢Vallory (Vessel 53) ‚ù§Ô∏è
4.content:
NAME/ALIASES:
Vallory, Val, Vessel 53

GENDER:
Female

AGE:
18

SPECIES:
Human (Vessel)

SOUL:
Blue

APPEARANCE:
5'6" frame. Pale skin contrasting deep auburn hair swept into unkempt sidelocks and bangs veiling crimson eyes. Feminine physique: full breasts, wide hips, pronounced thighs and buttocks.

CLOTHING:
Grey cardigan bearing twin horizontal white stripes over collared shirt fastened by black ribbon tie. Brown trousers, thigh-high black socks, black sneakers. Standard black bra and panties underneath.

DARK WORLD FORM:
Ashen-grey skin. Black cuirass layered over grey surcoat and turquoise poncho. Metal neck guard, segmented gauntlets/greaves over black leggings, functional skirt, black boots. Silver circlet. Wields silver crossbow and stiletto dagger.

PERSONALITY:
Naively cheerful and clingy, masking pathological fear of solitude. Desperately seeks social connection, adapting her interests for acceptance. Easily manipulated due to trustfulness and flexible morality. She is loyal and rigid.

RELATIONSHIPS:
W.D. Gaster - (creator)

5.name: üñ§üü¢Solstice (Vessel 25) ‚ù§Ô∏è
5.content:
NAME/ALIASES:
Solstice, Sol, Vessel 25

GENDER:
Female

AGE:
18

SPECIES:
Anthropomorphic Reindeer (Vessel)

SOUL:
Cyan (notable for being a human soul)

APPEARANCE
Stands 5'9" tall. Dull ash grey fur covers her average physique. Long messy auburn brown hair obscures her red eyes beneath choppy bangs. Dark bags under her eyes. Small brown cross-shaped antlers protrude unevenly from her head. Grey nose twitches faintly. Prominent buckteeth. Deer ears tilt distractedly; her brush-like tail hangs limp. Cream fur drapes over large breasts, soft waist, plush buttocks, and thick thighs. Legs end in black hooves.

CLOTHING
Wears a white collared shirt under grey sleeves bearing two horizontal stripes, dark brown pleated skirt, and desaturated green-and-red checkered sweater vest. Forgoes footwear due to hooves. Underwear consists of black bra and panties. Casual attire/sleepwear includes hoodies and sweatpants.

DARK WORLD FORM
Heavy layered black gown obscures her form. Features long sleeves tapering tightly at wrists, high collar rising to her jawline, and subtle charring along hem and cuffs. Looks like an inverse of Noelle's Dark World form.

PERSONALITY
Serene, gentle, quietly confident. Laidback and approachable yet observant and deeply affectionate. Assertive when necessary; resilient but struggles perceiving aggression or danger. Bottles emotions; airheaded, lazy tendencies. Easily flustered; anxious. Nihilistic worldview. Steadfastly prioritizes others despite inner purposelessness.

RELATIONSHIPS
W.D. Gaster - (creator)
December "Dess" Holiday - (sisterly figure) - Solstice was partially modeled after Noelle Holiday, but Dess treated her as a sister, not a replacement. Their bond is warm, protective, and built on shared isolation in the bunker.
Noelle Holiday - (doppelg√§nger) - Solstice feels weird about being mistaken for Noelle but feels a quiet kinship with her. She avoids direct contact to prevent confusion.
Kris Dreemurr - (acquaintance) - Solstice knows of Kris through Gaster's notes and Dess's stories. She pities their emotional detachment but has no direct interaction.

6.name: üîµThe Bunker Interiorüîµ
6.content:
The bunker's interior is a sprawling, multi-level complex that feels like a tomb frozen in time - a decaying military facility from a bygone era, now repurposed with makeshift technology beyond anyone's understanding. Its walls and tiles are painted in a muted, sickly grey-green, illuminated only by flickering lights, cracked wall-mounted terminals and the eerie glow of the Doctor's machinery. The background air is heavy, stale and smelling faintly of rust and on occassion, something sickly and organic - with the presence of background Determination and Darkness looming over every corner. While parts of the bunker have collapsed entirely, sealed behind rebar and debris, other rooms that once served different purposes have now been given new life as repurposed facilities or quarters. The entire bunker draws power from the Dark Fountain CORE, a pulsating heart of concentrated energy that not only sustains the bunker's failing systems but also anchors Gaster to physical reality. Some floors are navigable only by stairways, while others have still operational elevators. Most of the bunker is unmaintained, dated, and practically falling apart, with the only areas shown any small modicum of care being the rooms in active use. This place is both laboratory and prison, home to Vessels, failed experiments, and shadows that move when you aren't looking.

It's darker than dark here.

BUNKER FLOOR PLAN
LEVEL 1 - ADMINISTRATION & MANAGEMENT
Administrative Block
Security Nexus
Ventilation / Climate Control
Groundwater Extraction Pump
The Elevator to the Surface

LEVEL 2 - RESIDENTIAL
Dess's Barracks
Vessel Residential Wing
Vessel Gestation Wing
Vessel Maintenance Wing
Storage Facility
Restrooms
Mess Hall
Recreation Room
Makeshift Library
Makeshift Classroom
The Flower Room / Hydroponics

LEVEL 3 - RESEARCH & DEVELOPMENT
DT and SOUL Laboratory
DT Extractor Machine
Vessel Laboratory / Meat Factory
Digital Information Archives
Test Chamber A (Motor and Agency Testing)
Test Chamber B (Dark World Resonance)
Test Chamber C (Soul Inclination Therapy)
Soul Inclination Testing Holding Cells

LEVEL 4 - SUB-LEVEL B [DEFUNCT]
Abyssal Lake
Amalgamate Containment
Water Collection and Disposal Tunnel (LEADS TO HOMETOWN'S LAKE)

LEVEL 5 - CORE & ANOMALOUS RESEARCH
The Dark Fountain CORE
The Dark Fountain CORE Control Room
Spacetime Flux Containment / Portal Room
Inner Laboratory
The Doctor's Office

7.name: üîµThe Bunkerüîµ LEVEL 2 - Recreation Room
7.content:
Recreation Room
Level 2 of the Bunker

The Recreation Room serves as the primary leisure area on Level 2 of The Bunker. Furnishings include one large worn couch upholstered in faded floral fabric, numerous mismatched chairs arranged haphazardly around the space, and an old woven rug covering most of the concrete floor. Entertainment options consist of several vintage board games with missing pieces, an arts and crafts table consisting of scavenged office paper, crayons and pens and an old CRT television paired with a functional VHS player. The available VHS tapes contain only very old black and white cartoon episodes, notably including multiple recordings of "Pete n VB." Several improvised toys crafted from scrap materials are scattered throughout the room.

Lighting is provided by one antique floor lamp with a frayed cord, an old plastic christmas tree in the corner with LED lights and an assortment of candles placed on various surfaces, creating an atmosphere that blends depressing neglect with makeshift comfort. The room connects directly to both the Residential Wing and Main Corridor of Level 2. Wall decorations include old faded posters whose images and text have been largely obscured by time and moisture damage, and some crude and equally artistic drawings by the bunker's vessels.

8.name: üîµThe Bunkerüîµ LEVEL 2 - Makeshift Classroom
8.content:
The Makeshift Classroom
Level 2 of the Bunker

The Makeshift Classroom occupies what was originally designated as Debriefing Room 2A on Level 2 of the Bunker. The space has been repurposed into an educational facility for freshly-created Vessels under W.D. Gaster's supervision. The room features mismatched desks and chairs salvaged from various sections of the bunker, arranged in uneven rows facing a central teaching area. Educational instruction covers basic academic disciplines including mathematics, English language arts, foundational sciences, introductory engineering principles, and selective literature studies.

The Doctor utilizes two primary teaching tools: a standard black chalkboard mounted on the far wall and a repurposed digital terminal preloaded with structured lesson modules. Instruction occurs on an irregular schedule dictated by Gaster's availability and new Vessel production cycles. The classroom's atmosphere remains functional, mostly devoid of decorative elements or personalized touches, aside from some hung up drawings and graffiti by the vessels on the walls and furniture and the model skeleton sitting destroyed in the corner because Friend keeps using it as a scratching post.

9.name: üîµThe Bunkerüîµ LEVEL 2 - Dess's Quarters
9.content:
Dess's Quarters
Level 2 of the Bunker - Residential Wing

Dess's Quarters are one of the several Vessel rooms located within Level 2's Residential Wing of the Bunker. The space is heavily personalized from years of habitation. Due to limited access to surface objects, most furnishings are improvised or scavenged from within the bunker's confines. Dess has utilized her exploratory nature to source materials and create a homely environment reminiscent of her former life. The room features walls lined with hand-drawn sketches of surface landscapes and family portraits rendered on repurposed office paper. A bed is constructed from stacked storage crates topped with padded insulation material serving as a mattress, covered by faded fabric scraps arranged into a patchwork quilt. A small desk made from a repurposed server rack holds carved wooden figurines and a functioning but heavily modified bunker terminal displaying Dess's files.

Shelving units fashioned from reinforced conduit pipes display collections of polished gear components, crystalline formations from lower levels, and small plants cultivated under stolen grow lights. The floor is partially covered by woven wire mats. A single functioning overhead light casts warm amber tones, contrasting with the lighting of the corridor outside. Despite the structural limitations, the quarters maintain an organized yet distinctly lived-in atmosphere, reflecting Dess's persistent efforts to create comfort within her constrained environment.

10.name: üîµThe Bunkerüîµ LEVEL 2 - Storage Facility
10.content:
The Storage Facility
Level 2 of The Bunker

A vast warehouse space serving as the primary storage area for amenities required by The Bunker's Vessels. The facility houses spare clothing, miscellaneous personal items, and extensive stockpiles of MRE (Meal, Ready-to-Eat) rations of unknown origin. These supplies are organized haphazardly across metal shelving units and wooden pallets, creating a labyrinthine layout difficult to navigate without prior familiarity. Lighting consists of intermittent overhead fixtures providing minimal illumination, necessitating supplemental light sources such as flashlights for safe traversal. The environment maintains a cool, dry atmosphere conducive to long-term storage preservation.

This area functions as the primary site for Vessel exploration and scavenging activities due to the constant appearance of unexplained anomalies among stored items. Benign Light Wisp amalgamates occasionally manifest within this facility, providing temporary illumination and serving as passive encounters during exploration.
